characters: INTO AN UNSEEN PIT DUG JUST BENEATH THE SURFACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high desert -- absolutely silent -- a vast, hard land scape stretching away to distant mountains.  The silence broken by hoof-beats.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. EDGAR'S PLACE
dialogues.text: It's a simple cabin dwarfed by a big, ramshackle barn.  E DEEMS (60s), a weathered desert rat of a hermit, is walki his donkey around in circles. Now, rattling toward them down an endless dirt road, come old, sun-bleached Buick.  It stops and out leans OLD FRED (70s) wearing a sweat-stained fedora.  The two friends no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to lay down.  I'm a little worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Fred climbs out with a bushel basket of carrots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I brung her something I know she likes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Fred, you can't give away all those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  I got vegetables coming out my ears.  Usually the varmints eat up half my crop, but lately I ain't so much as seen a gopher or a jack-rabbit nowheres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that ain't the truth.  And I count on them for a little bit of stew meat...Thank you, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar takes the carrots and feeds one to the donkey. Here you go, Justine.  Look what Fred brought you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We playing cards tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna be sitting up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd do the same.  Well, catch you Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men nod, and Old Fred drives off. CLOSE-UP of the donkey's hooves thumping along as Edgar l her to the barn. Let's get you out of the sun for a spell. I'll get you some fresh water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, suddenly, we hear the donkey restlessly stomping its hooves and braying.  Edgar turns, concerned.  Now we hear odd sound.  Distant thunder?  The wind?  The donkey gets and more frantic. The barn shudders violently.  Frightened birds explode fr the eaves.  Dust puffs from every old seam.  Roof shingle rain down.  Edgar stares in amazement. ...some kind of earthquake!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then another sound -- the donkey starts screeching in wil panic. Justine, hang on! I'm coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar races back to the barn and flings open the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust swirls through the air.  But -- the barn in empty. donkey.  Now Edgar is hit by a ghastly stench.  He stagge back, and covers his nose with a handkerchief.  Then he s splattered across the walls -- blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the name of Jehovah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his arms above the door frame.  When he lowers he's holding a 12 gauge shotgun.  He races outside, ready shoot, but there's nothing -- as far as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun lights up spectacular sheer cliffs which plunge 1 feet from a ruggedly beautiful high-desert plateau.  At t top of the cliffs, silhouetted against the dawn, a lone c boy seems to gaze in deep contemplation at the sunrise. we MOVE IN, we realize he's actually peeing over the clif This is VALENTINE MCKEE (25).  Smart and good looking, Va has nevertheless managed to underachieve brilliantly.  He coasts through life, following the path of least resistan -- which has brought him to this dubious rustic existence the edge of civilization.  But lately he's beginning to wonder why he hasn't accomplished more in his 25 years. As a few sleepy cows gaze at him, sleepy Val shuffles ove his battered old pickup truck.  A hand-painted sign on th door reads: "V & E -- All Type's of Job's."  Indeed, the pick-up bed is jumbled with tools and supplies for every conceivable odd job -- and the noisily snoring form of hi partner huddled in a dirty sleeping bag.  Val raps on the side of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Good morning, Mr. Bassett, this is your wake-up call.  Please move your fat ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from the sleeping bag.  Val stares at the cow chewing their cud -- and perks up as he gets an idea.  He gently steps onto the truck's running board, then suddenl starts jumping up and down as hard as he can, rocking the truck violently. STAMPEDE!  EARL, GET OUT OF THE WAY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleeping bag tries to get up and run for it.  It tumb out of the back of the pickup.  While Val laughs uproar- iously, EARL BASSET (43) claws his way out of the bag, lo around wildly, and finds himself staring at three motionl cows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dumb shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl is a good-ol' boy who has lived his life just like V drifting from job to job.  He knows why he hasn't accom- plished anything, and often tries to impart his hard-won wisdom to Val, but the last thing the younger man wants i advice. Earl stretches.  The men begin a silent ritual:  Earl gro through his pockets for a cigarette, but only finds a lighter.  Meanwhile, Val digs in his pockets, coming up w cigarettes, but no lighter.  Typical of these two, each g always has half of what he needs.  Eventually they sort i out,  trading the necessary implements. Earl reaches for a coffee-pot on a battered Coleman stove the tailgate.  But it's cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't cook breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it yesterday.  Franks and beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to recall) No...it was eggs.  I did eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell you did.  Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl raises his fist.  This is The Challenge, and it inst triggers the partners' conflict-resolution technique.  Th solve all disputes using the children's game of "scissors rock, paper."  Earl raises his fist in response.  The gam played swiftly and silently -- one, two, three.  On three Val mimes "paper" (open hand.  Earl mimes "scissors" (two extended fingers).  Scissors cuts paper.  Val has lost. shrugs and starts pumping up the stove fuel tank. Well, when I'm your age I'll probably forget what I eat, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl are restringing a dilapidated, and seemingly endless, barbed wire fence.  A few bored cows watch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many cows does it take to make a stampede?  Is it like three or more?  Is there a minimum speed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I was in one.  A bolt of lightning blew up cottonwood tree.  Three hundred head going hell-bent for the horizon.  Wasn't so damn funny, I can  tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl's hand slips and the fence snags him right through h thick glove. Ow!  God damn!  Is this a job for intelligent men?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there was one nearby I'd probably ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep thinking, if we were but half serious about money, we should quit being hired hands and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock serious) Handymen, Earl.  We're handymen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever the hell we are, we should quit and go get ourselves some real employment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val gestures to the vastness around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, and give up all this personal freedom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val guides the truck down a tortuous, rocky, almost impas sable trail.  It takes full concentration as he fights th steering wheel, shifts, rides the brake and leans out try to pick a decent route.  Earl braces his feet on the dash munches breakfast, a raw hot dog right out of the package

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn jeep trail gets worse every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Has a lot of rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl pulls a box of Hershey bars from under the seat.  Th only one bar left.  He sets the box down between them.  V glances at it -- and raises his fist: The Challenge.  One two, three.  Val mimes "paper;" Earl mimes "rock."  Earl loses.  Val takes the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing ahead) You're gonna get us hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not talk to the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWONK!  The truck lurches to a stop, its frame caught on big rock.  Val glares at Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up turns from a dirt road onto an old paved road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have next?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Earl consults a crumpled list pulled from inside his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Digging that waterhole for Nestor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather's place is closer. Let's do their kitchen today.  Do Nestor tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestor's out of town tomorrow.  We don't dig today.  We don't get paid today.  Damn it, Valentine, you never plan ahead.  You never take the long view.  Hell, here it is Monday and I'm already working on Wednesday. (squints dubiously at his schedule) It is Monday, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Val is peering at the desert up ahead.  Off the road ways is a small Toyota pick-up truck and, beside it, a lo figure trying to flag them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell's that?  That's not what's his name...the grad student?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it's September.  Must be the new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new one!  That's supposed to be a girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl braces himself, knowing what Val will do.  Val swerv the truck wildly off the road, barreling across the deser (almost praying) You will have long blonde hair, big green eyes, nice full breasts that stand up and say hello, ass that won't quit.  And legs, legs that go all the way up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl shakes his head, mildly bemused as they slide to a s in a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks out hopefully.  The dust clears.  He sees her - RHONDA LeBECK, (25).  Val's eyes do an expert vertical sc short brown hair, small brown eyes, so-so chest, legs hid in baggy dungarees. Laden with a portable computer, notebooks, and some seismograph printouts, she stares at him through tilted glasses.  Her little pick-up truck is loaded with geology field equipment.  She shakes Val's hand firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly) Hi, I'm Rhonda.  Rhonda LeBeck. I'm up here for the semester...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, geography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, geology.  And you have to be Val and Earl.  I've heard all about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We deny everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, got a question for you.  Do you know if anybody is doing any blasting or drilling or anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around here?  Why would they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm supposed monitor these seismographs.  You know, they measure vibrations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, vibrations in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm getting what I refer to scientifically as "weird vibes."  every sensor I've got is giving me strange readings.  I mean, the school has had these machines up here three years and they've never recorded anything like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll ask around.  Let you know if we hear of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  God, I hope they're not screwed up.  I might have to bag the whole semester. Anyway, sorry to bother you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  Nice meeting you. Hope you get it sorted out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda unhappily turns back to her equipment as Val and E drive off.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Earl glances over at Val with a gleam in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if you wanted, we could take a look at those seismographs for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do we know about seismographs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  But it sure might be a nice way of getting to know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Valentine, you won't go for any gal unless she fits that damn list of yours A to Z...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And is dumber than my hind end. Like that Bobby Lynn Dexter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val flips down the truck's sunvisor.  Tapes to it are sna shots of nearly identical blonde bimbos.  Val points to o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) Tammy Lynn Baxter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't matter.  They're all the same: dead weight.  Can't make a decision, can't walk because of their shoes, can't work because of their fingernails.  Make my skin crawl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm a victim of circumstance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you called it your pecker.  Look, don't make the mistake I made.  Twenty years of looking for a woman exactly like Miss October 1968, and where'd it get me?  Here with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val rolls his eyes -- "Give me a break."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up rattles toward a tiny, utterly isolated high desert hamlet -- a few dozen houses and mobile homes figh for shade in the vast landscape.  Its most prominent feat is an aging wood-frame water tower, perhaps 25 feet high, near the center of town.  A sign PANS into view -- "PERFECTION -- Pop. 14."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl head past the water tower for Pham Van's Gen Store, Perfection's main gossip stop and only business. store's sign, in English and Vietnamese, reads: "Grocerie Haircuts, Post Office, Town Hall, VIDEOS!"  Val and Earl next to a camouflage-painted, large-tired Blazer. Just then they spot MELVIN, the town's surly teen-aged pa in-the-ass, coming toward them, mindlessly bouncing a basketball off the hoods of parked cars.  As he nears the truck:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin, touch that truck and die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, I'm really shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he steers clear of their truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the energetic Vietnamese owner, PHAM VAN, preside over his all-purpose establishment: part general store, p barber shop, part saloon. At the bar are BURT GUMMER and his wife HEATHER, two no- nonsense survivalists who have settled in Perfection to a the coming apocalypse -- a nice enough couple, but there' hint of paranoia around the edges.  Burt is shoving a box cartridges across to Pham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Pham, they're not hollow points.  I ordered hollow points and that's what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Val and Earl enter, Pham automatically pops the tops two cold beers and has them in place before the cowboys r the bar.  Everyone exchanged nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys, what you been up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ran into the new college student, Rona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda.  Rhonda LeBeck.  She's getting some kind of strange readings on her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you know, those kids turn up oil or uranium or something out there...next thing the Feds will be at our door.  "Sorry, time to move. Eminent domain."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down, honey, down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Burt.  The way you worry, you're gonna have a heart attack before you get to survive World War III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Pham laugh.  Burt smiles patiently.  Just the the compressor in Pham's ice cream freezer comes on.  It' loud chug-chug-chug sound mixed with a high-pitched squea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Val, listen.  Bearing going out, you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts toward the compressor, but Earl heads him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch it later, Pham.  Gotta get over to Nestor's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  We plan ahead.  That way we don't do anything right now.  Earl explained it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they turn to go, Val does a take, amazed, as he spots decorative bleached-out cattle skull displayed on the cou -- with a $29.95 price tag. Hey, Pham Van, what the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beauty, isn't it?  We bought three of them for the rec room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Pham Van) We sell 'em to you for three bucks a piece!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) And I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully) You don't get it, Pham.  The idea was: we were ripping you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a car alarm blares from outside.  Burt's out the door in a flash.  The others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt races out and shouts at Melvin who back guiltily awa from Burt's camouflage Blazer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin, you little pain-in-the-ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me, man!  Your truck's just screwed up, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt angrily switches off the alarm.  Val and Earl laugh they climb into their truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't his parents ever take him to Vegas with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta ask that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At one end of town, Earl maneuvers a huge bulldozer with scoop-loader blade through a choking cloud of dust, scour out a shallow pit to serve as a watering hole.  Val sight down a row of stakes which mark one end of the pit.  The is done.  He signals Earl to cut the engine.  Both men ha kerchiefs covering their faces and are totally encrusted dust.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK TRAILER
dialogues.text: Nearby is an old battered truck trailer -- the massive, s steel kind used for heavy rock hauling.  Tires flat, mire dried mud and weeds, it hasn't been used in years.  Now i provides welcome shade as the men sit sipping some coffee NESTOR CUNNINGHAM drives up, surveying the pit with appro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came out great, boys.  Should fill up just fine come the next rain.  Lemme have your bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl and Val start fishing in their pockets for pen and paper.  Earl comes up with various pieces of paper, Val w three or four pens.  It's a moment before they realize ea has the other needed implement.  Earl writes out the bill during: I'll have to send it to you the first of the month, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl exchange pained looks. Now, you know I'm good for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Nestor, we know.  Don't worry about it.  Catch us when you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They amble over to their truck.  Earl takes the driver's -- and starts fishing in his pockets for the key. Are we too easy-going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're not too easy-going.  This area is economically depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val realizes he has the key and hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what if we just did it...today. Pack up.  Drive straight down to Bixby.  Get serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could.  We could.  But we'd have to get really serious.  It's gonna cost twice as much to rent a place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  That car wash pays good, and they're always looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car wash?!  That's got no future. If we're gonna take the plunge we oughta have a better plan than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.  Go ahead and plan it...for a year or two.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. VIOLA'S PLACE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a stencilled sign: PHAM VAN'S U-RENT -- CESSPOOL SEPTIC TANKS.  PULL OUT to see Val and Earl have rented a portable septic pump (perhaps trailer mounted).  The aged machine reeks of and drips with its ignoble cargo.  The intake hose has been repaired so often it looks to be mor tape than hose.  Grimacing Val threads the slimy hose dow through the open top of Viola's cesspool. Beside them is Viola's well-kept mobile home on a low hil not far from Pham Van's store.  Well-kept flower gardens surround the place.  VIOLA, a sweet little old lady, watc the men work while straining to hold the leash of her tin but ferocious dog.  The dog yaps continuously, lunging at Val and Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  Stop it, you horrid animal! (to Val and Earl) I'm going to give her back to my son.  I swear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Viola, you've got my permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God almighty, my mama sure didn't raise me for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val gets up and starts the pump's gas engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're the one won't work in the car wash.  You're the one's gotta have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Val!  Not having a plan is what keeps us doing jobs like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl angrily throws the pump valve and starts the pump mechanism.  He and Val on stand either side of the intake hose as it gurgles happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What keeps us doing jobs like this is you dragging your feet.  I was up for going to Bixby.  I was getting excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the past year I must've said a hundred times "We gotta get out of Perfection.  We gotta better ourselves."  You gonna stand there in broad daylight and tell me you think I'm the reason we're still here?  You want to know how close I am to going to Bixby right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call that little bluff.  How close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POW!  GOOOOSH!  The gurgling intake hose ruptures, shower them with -- well you know.  They react as if they'd been shot; gagging, staggering, screaming obscenities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl's beat-up mobile home is just down the stree from Pham Van's store.  Val and Earl, now in cleaner clot march out resolutely.  Val has a portable TV in one hand a framed COORS beer sign in the other.  Earl unhooks the clothes line and dumps it, clothes and all, into the back their truck, on top of the rest of their belongings. They stare at each other for a moment.  This is it.  No g back.  They leap into the truck.  As they drive off, Val out and yanks their wooden nameplate ("E. Basset -- V. Mc off the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't gone fifty yards when they spot NANCY STERNG (40s) working in front of her house.  The guys pull their hats low over their faces.  Earl swerves to the far side the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh, it's Nancy.  She wants another load of firewood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, man.  It's not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy spots them and beckons excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got us.  Now, listen, the plan is: we have done our last job in Perfection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop beside Nancy.  While they talk, Nancy's daughte MINDY (9), comes bouncing along on her pogo-stick, listen to her Walkman and slowly circling the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindy, honey, don't pogo in the street.  Hey, guys, I've got a job for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Nancy.  We ain't doing odd jobs anymore.  We're headed for Bixby permanent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Oh, sure... (sees stuff in back of truck) ...My God, you really are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, we're relocating to an area with a greater economic base. (to Mindy, over her music) Hey, Mindy, what's the count?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hundred three, six hundred four, six hundred five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, guys.  I made the big decision.  I'm putting in that satellite dish.  I was going to offer you five hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl glance at each other -- five hundred dollars

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck roars toward the "Leaving Perfection" sign.  Va and Earl are elated, downright giddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it!  We faced temptation and we did not bend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight!  Now there's nothing between us and Bixby but nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They zoom past the sign. Last time we'll see that sign!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh, then are thrown half out of their seats as Ea accidentally hits a big pothole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time we hit that goddamn pothole!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: As the truck streaks across the landscape.  Val and Earl merrily continue their good-byes to whatever is visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, cactus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios, bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On its way down from the high desert, the lonely road now winds through a twisting, narrow canyon.  A county highwa maintenance truck is parked to one side and two road work CARMINE and HOWARD, repair a slide-damaged section of the road, Carmine breaking up asphalt with a jackhammer.  Val Earl pull up, hand them each a beer, and speed away, shou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time down this damn twisty road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up speeds past a small shack.  Val and Earl automatically roll up their windows.  In a moment we see a monster, ferocious dog comes galloping out to chase the truck.  Earl gives the dog the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last chance, asshole.  Run, run...!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OLD FRED'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Old Fred latches the gate on his corral filled with sheep He looks up as Val and Earl's truck speeds past.  Val and honk their horn and wave happily.  Old Fred waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up zooms along, the road now paralleling a line tall high-tension electrical towers.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The guys have calmed down, but each is still dreaming of new life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's the plan.  We bust our tails in the car wash six months... well, maybe nine...and we don't spend a dime, you know?  And then we go for it...down payment on a tow-truck or a back-hoe or something, right?  Start a real business.  We can start looking for something today, tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val points up ahead -- a man is sitting near the top of a distant electrical tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, look at that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) One job I'd never take is working around electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially when it's two hundred feet off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as the pass the tower: Hey, hold up...That's Edgar Deems!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's only got one damn jacket. That's him, I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl pulls over.  They climb out and peer up at the tower Edgar is hard to see through the criss-crossing girders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) Man, oh, man.  He must've really been drunk this time. (shouts) Edgar!  What the hell you doing? Get on down from there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar doesn't move.  Val and Earl shift about uncomfortab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit, we can't leave him up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.  Someone's got to climb up.  Va raises his fist in The Challenge.  Their fingers fly.  Ro breaks scissors.  Val loses. Valentine unhappily climbs the tall tower while Earl watc from below. Hey, Edgar, don't you move.  I'm coming to get you...You damn fool, you owe me on this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Higher and higher Val climbs.  He tries not to look down. He's approaching Edgar from below and behind.  As he gets nearer he begins to notice forboding details: one of Edga shoes is missing, half the trouser led is torn off.. Edga strapped to a girder by his belt, his shotgun gripped in hands.  A swarm of flies buzzes away. What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He edges around to where he can see Edgar's face -- the eyes are wide open, staring.  He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OLD FRED'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Old Fred is now hoeing his garden.  He glances up as Val Earl's pick-up roars back toward Perfection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big station wagon is parked between a small mobile home a half-finished house being built by JIM and MEGAN WALLAC an out-going, energetic older couple.  Lumber, cinder blo and tools are scattered around the yard. Jim examines Edgar's body in the bed of Val and Earl's pi up truck.  Val, Earl and Megan talk in subdued tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real sorry to bother you, Megan, but we figured since Jim's a doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine.  You did the right thing.  When Jim is done we'll call the Coroner's office in Bixby. We'll take care of it. (shakes her head) Poor Edgar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to break the mood) Well, I see you got all the wallboard up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was easy.  You two did the hard part.  Sure sorry you're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim climbs out of the pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was is a heart attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) He died of dehydration.  Thirst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that doesn't make sense.  That takes a couple of days, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three or four even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he sat up there three or four days?  Just sat there till he died of thirst?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim shrugs.  Everyone is mystified.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OLD FRED'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Fred is still hoeing.  In the nearby pen his sheep start acting restless.  He eyes them.  What's up?  We hear a strange muffled sound.  Unseen, behind him, at the far en the garden, his scarecrow mysteriously tilts. Old Fred keeps hoeing.  He stops, his foot is caught in t dirt.  Suddenly he is yanked knee-deep into the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl's truck, again headed for Bixby, and going w too fast, zooms past the two workers still repairing the road.  The workers glance up, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl, sobered and deep in thought, drive past the shack where the ferocious dog lives.  They automatically up their windows during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reckon he hated Perfection more than us?  You suppose he wanted to kill himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he did, why didn't he use his damn shotgun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he just couldn't pull the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, he figured it was easier to die of thirst?  Come on, sombody must've chased him up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean somebody who ain't scared of a twelve gauge shotgun. And then what did they do?  Camp out down below and just wait for him to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val has no answer.  It's too weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whatever the hell happened it's just one more goddamn good reason to haul ass out of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are passing the shack.  Earl suddenly realizes: Hey, where the hell's that asshole dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Probably up a pole starving itself to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, the plan is: pedal to the metal the whole way.  We don't stop till we hit the carwash, not even to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with that plan.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OLD FRED'S PLACE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the pick-up's tires skidding to a stop.  PULL OU see we're back at Old Fred's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl is staring wide-eyed.  Val follows Earl's gaze and i aghast when he sees -- The sheep pen -- it's a ghastly, bloody mess.  Scattered the churned up ground a few dismembered sheep legs and he are all that remain of the flock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) What the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl leap out of the truck to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Old Fred!  Fred!  Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl dashes into Fred's house.  Val checks around outside Earl comes back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they spot something lying in the middle of the garde Old Fred's hat. Still looking all around, Val squats distractedly to pick the hat.  He and Earl stumble backward in shock. OLD FRED IS STILL WEARING HIS HAT!!  His mangled face sta up at them, eyes and mouth frozen open in a death grimace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?  I mean WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine and Howard continue repairing the road, Carmine s using the noisy jackhammer.  Val and Earl drive up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys better get the hell outta here!  We got a killer on the loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine stops jackhammering to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murderer, man!  A real psycho. He's cutting people's heads off! I'm serious!  I'd high-tail for town if I was you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl speed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he edges over to the truck and takes out a heavy stee pry-bar to keep within easy reach. Carmine goes back to work, pounding the asphalt with the jackhammer.  Suddenly the blade strikes something beneath road, something soft.  We hear a strange, unearthly shrie from underground.  A weird orange goo gushes up around th blade.  Then the jackhammer takes off by itself like a harpoon stuck in a whale!  Carmine gets tangled in the ja hammer's air-hose and is dragged along, shouting for help Howard chases him down the embankment and into the scrub- brush.  He hears Carmine screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine!  What the hell is it?! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now there is only silence.  Howard crashes through th brush.  All he finds is the torn end of the air-hose -- w suddenly sucks down into the ground.  He's momentarily staggered by an awful smell, but forces himself to keep looking.  He lets the pry-bar drag on the ground.  Then something -- it looks like a mouth or a horrid beak -- sh out of the ground and grips the pry-bar with uncanny strength!  Howard drops his weapon and scrambles madly aw He clambers back onto the road.  But almost immediately cracks form in the pavement around him.  More beak-things break through the asphalt between him and his truck. He dashes across the road, scrambling up the embankment. clings precariously to a tree root, looking down -- where they go?  Suddenly the dirt around him begins to "bubble. Several hungry beaks break through and grab him, yanking head first into the embankment.  Then the embankment give way, crashing down onto the road, taking with it a nearby telephone pole and snapping the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pham Van is talking to MIGUEL, a local rancher.  They bot jump as the doors burst open.  Val and Earl race in, trai by Nestor and Melvin.  Val heads for the payphone during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head?  You mean just his head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val grabs the phone and digs in his pocket for change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, really sick, man.  Sweet Old Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl comes up with change and hands it to Val, who dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something happen to Fred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Pham) Are you serious, man?  They killed him just to take his sheep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't have nothing else to steal.  Neither did Edgar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Edgar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val stares at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.  The phone is out!  Pham, your phone is out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it!  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl rush out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trailed by the others Val and Earl march out and leap int their truck , Val driving now.  He searches for the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta get the police up here. You guys gotta step on it to Bixby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl hands Val the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it stepped on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again the pick-up barrels through the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother, we decided to leave this place just one day too late, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) Well, there's sure as hell nothing to stop us now.  Everybody we know between here and Bixby is already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl points ahead and screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOK OUT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val brings the truck to a squealing stop.  Ahead: the collapsed embankment completely blocks the road.  It's totally impassable.  The cowboys are dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is some higher force at work, here? Are we asking too much of life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Val is in no mood for philosophy.  He leaps out and p into the highway maintenance truck which sits undisturbed emergency lights still flashing.  There's nobody in it. starts looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those assholes are supposed to be fixing the goddamn road! (shouts) Hey!  Where are you guys?  People gotta use this road, you know! You on a booze break or what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers; urgently pointing) Val!  Val!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks where he's pointing -- Howard's bloodstained hardhat lies at the edge of the landslide.  Val gets the point.  Looking around for the unknown assailant, he ease back into the truck.  Earl already has a pistol in his la and is digging through the glove compartment. Where are the bullets?  Don't we have any goddamn bullets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val quickly jockeys the truck to turn it around on the na road.  But as he backs into the hillside, we hear a stran grating clunk from underneath.  When he tries to pull forward, the truck won't move.  The engine stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  I don't believe this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hung up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both lean out.  The rear tires are clear.  Val resta the truck and tries to pull forward, rocking the truck against some unseen pull.  Smoke wells up from the clutch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hung up I tell you.  You're gonna burn the clutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val slams the truck into low-range four-wheel-drive and r it.  The tires dig in, fighting for traction -- and sudde the truck lurches free.  We hear an eerie shriek mingled gear and engine noise as Val angrily roars away. Jesus, you can break an axle like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't want spend the night out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word has spread.  Everybody in town is gathered at Ph Van's.  They rush out to meet Val and Earl as they drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you doing back already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never going to believe this, but the canyon road...we were on it not two hours ago...well, it's completely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he stops because they're all staring wide-eyed at the rear of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl jump out and look where everyone else is looking.  Their jaws drop.  REVEAL: hanging from the rear axle of their truck and trailing out behind like a nightm wedding decoration -- a sex foot long, grotesque, fleshy, tentacle.  The end gripping the axle looks like a vicious razor-sharp beak or hook.  The trailing end is mutilated, oozing orange goo -- as though the creature was torn in h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unreal!  Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...didn't know we had it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like...and eel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw...eels live in water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...it's some kind of snake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a big mother slug maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of mutation...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt, more daring than the others, pries the thing off th axle with a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch, don't touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead all right.  Tore the damn thing in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must've grabbed us.  That's why the truck stalled-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly indignant) Yeah!  Next time I tell you I'm not hung up...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stalled out your truck?  Have to be one strong son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pham Van leaps over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you boys five dollars for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl square their shoulders.  This time they're r for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, ten dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one of these couldn't eat up off a whole flock of sheep. There's gotta be more out there, a lot more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold chill spreads through the group.  They stare out a the vast, forbidding desert.  They suddenly feel alone -- very alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Rhonda's hat lying on the ground.  We think the worst.  Then she reaches in, picks it up and puts it on. REVEAL she's in a lonely corner of the valley working wit seismograph.  She pounds a marking stake into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE ON SEISMOGRAPH
dialogues.text: The needle responds to each blow on the stake.  We hear Rhonda stop pounding.  The needle stops.  All is silent - but the needle starts moving again!"

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: LOW CAMERA is MOVING in Rhonda's general direction.  She starts to pound another stake.  CAMERA REACTS so it is mo straight toward her.  As it passes a burrow, a rabbit suddenly scouts out.  CAMERA WHIP PANS to watch the rabbi scamper into the distance, then TURNS BACK to move toward Rhonda, who still pounding her stake. CAMERA passes Rhonda's seismograph.  The machine tilts slightly as the ground bulges up beneath it. Rhonda finishes pounding.  She heads for her truck, noisi tossing in her tools and slamming the tailgate.  CAMERA CLOSES IN on her, faster and faster.  It is right on her heels as she climbs into the cab!

dialogues.speaker: RHONDA'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: A beak-thing thrusts out of the ground, groping where Rhonda's boot just was.  Rhonda drives off, unknowingly running right over the thing.  We hear a shriek of pain a the tentacle writhes and sucks back under the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindy Sterngood poses cautiously with the bizarre hook tentacle.   A camera FLASHES and we REVEAL Pham Van takin her photo beside a sign: "Photographs -- You and the Snak Monster -- $2.00."  Viola and Miguel, wait in line. We now see the store is crowded with concerned townsfolk debating what to do, and how to protect themselves.  Val Earl sit on the sidelines, sipping beer, gazing in awe at enterprising Phan Vam:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick as snot and I'm not lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen lousy bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man who plans ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominating the discussion are Burt and Heather now armed scoped, magnum hunting rifles.  Heather stands guard at a window, peering out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to group) ...Look, we organize, we arm ourselves.  We go out, we find those damn snake things, we make 'em extinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Burt, we don't even know what they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be aliens.  Who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why go looking for trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, the trouble's come to us. If we're not ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone's out.  Road's out.  We're on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) And you two just love it, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Nancy, don't let's get personal.  We need to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt steps over to a faded topographic map on the wall an points out details during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right.  You folks gotta analyze the situation.  With that road out we're completely cut off. Got the cliffs to the north, mountains east and west.  That's why Heather and me settled here in the first place, geographic isolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...there must be dome way to get help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How, for chrissake?  You gonna walk thirty-eight miles to Bixby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what about Pham Van's saddle horses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All heads turn toward Pham Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to them.  Does anybody know how to ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All heads turn toward Val and Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the vast desert night a single floodlight illuminates and Megan's partially finished house.  Their station wago parked out front.  A country and western tune drifts to u from it's radio. As we MOVE CLOSER, we see the floodlight is powered by a small, softly purring generator set maybe fifty feet away Jim and Megan, both exhausted, unload a big stack of roof shingles from their station wagon.  Jim starts to lift a package of shingles but gives up and sits on the tailgate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dead.  Let's finish in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go into Bixby in the morning. (grins devilishly) The concrete blocks are in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The con...!  Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep looking at that beautiful sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the sky that's going to be over our roof every night, when we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) Ah, but consider this, if we don't finish the roof, we can looks at that sky all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the whirring of the generator becomes strangely muffled.  The floodlight flickers.  Now the generator die Darkness engulfs them.  The car radio music drones on incongruously. Damn that thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) We could always buy a new generator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim digs out a powerful flashlight and heads over toward generator.  Megan lies back, taking a welcome breather. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's wrong with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...gone...!

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Baffled, he sweeps the whole area with the flashlight.  M joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this is where it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I sure?! (points with flashlight) It was right there.  There's the cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The severed electric cable stops at the edge of a cone-sh depression in the dirt where the generator sat.  He hands the flashlight and kneels.  We watch tensely as he probes loose earth with his hands. Maybe the ground caved in.  There's a lot of old mines and stuff around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan grabs his shirt, trying to pull him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't then!  You don't want to fall in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, about ten feet away -- WHOOMP!!  The generator shoots up out of the ground!  Jim and Megan dive for cove it sails through the air, and crashes to earth.  They sta transfixed.  The generator is dented and bent almost beyo recognition -- and covered with oozing slime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Megan is all action.  She yanks him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Get away from it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, what a stink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We again hear that mysterious rumbling sound.  Jim stops, sweeping the flashlight around them. Hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind!  Let's go!  Let's just go into town or something!  Jim, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hustles him bodily toward the car during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I bet it's geological or something, like natural gas, or a geyser.  They stink like that. Remember in Yellowstone...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he drops knee-deep into ground!  Megan is thrown off balance and tumbles to one side.  The flashlight fall lighting them at an eerie low angle. Something's got me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear sickening CRUNCHES from below the earth.  He SCRE in excruciating agony. Oh, God!  Get me Out!!  GET ME OUT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles wildly, but just sinks further down!  Megan slides a 2X4 over to Jim.  He grabs it like a drowning ma trying to keep himself from being pulled down.  But he's pulled with suck power the 2X4 snaps! His head is going under.  Megan desperately tries to dig smothering earth away, but she's losing.  Now only his ar are above ground.  She pulls with all her might, but he s inexorably down, down.  She's pulled flat on the ground. He's gone. The next instant, a vicious hook-tentacle erupts through earth, missing Megan's face by inches.  She scrambles bac frantically.

dialogues.speaker: STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: LOW CAMERA pursues Megan toward the car, just missing her she dives in through the open tailgate.  She slams it aft her.  The talons rake across the car, scratching the glas Megan tumbles into the front seat.  Thank God the keys ar the ignition.  She starts the engine.  But outside the "s things" attack the car in a frenzy, slashing blindly.  A tire is totally shredded just as: Megan floors it.  The car lurches forward but the mutilat tire falls apart.  The wheel rim digs into the loose eart and the car is stuck.  With no other recourse, Megan lock the door, rolls up the windows and cowers in the middle o the car, panting, sobbing.  The radio is still playing a happy cowboy tune.  She peeks out.  They gave up?  She's safe?  Nothing happens for a moment, then -- The car starts to shake and shudder!  Dust wells up aroun windows. Outside we see a bizarre sight.  The earth around the rea the car is "boiling," dirt flying in all directions -- an the car starts to sink into the ground!! Megan wildly honks the horn!  The car looks just like a s going down by the stern, hood tilting up gracefully.  The back windows shatter, dirt pouring in!  Megan smashes the windshield with a small fire extinguisher and scrambles o on the hood.  But there's no hope.  The car keeps sinking titling now almost ninety degrees, forcing her onto a precarious perch on the grille -- sinking, sinking. Out of her mind with terror, she keeps softly murmuring t same hopeless phrases:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  Stop it!  Somebody stop it...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights are two ironic beacons sending their beams skyward through the roiling dust into the night sky.  The sound of the radio becomes muffled.  The headlights sink view -- and then Megan's scream floats across the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out front of Pham Van's, nervous Val and Earl saddle up t horses while Pham loads their saddle bags with food.  Eve one has gathered to see them off.  There's an air of tens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing the horses) Pham, we don't want to be stuck on a couple of canners.  They better be fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.  A snake thing like that couldn't move too quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you.  For all you know they could fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl pulls their old Smith and Wesson revolver and batter Winchester rifle out of the pick-up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the rifle or the Smith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (definite) The rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does Earl.  He raises his hand.  They swiftly do a rou of scissors-rock-paper.  Earl loses.  He hands Val the ri Just then, Burt and Heather pull up in their Blazer, clim out with their hunting rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys all set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready as we'll ever be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and I are going to drive around a little, see if we can find that college girl and tell her to get her ass back into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea.  And we'll swing by the doctor's place.  They were going to go into Bixby but we don't know if they left before the road was out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl mount up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.  You guys oughta take something that packs more punch than that thirty-thirty.  Take one of our Browning autos, or even my model seventy... (offers her hunting rifle) It's three-seventy-five H and H mag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl takes the awesome-looking gun with a smug glance at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee...thanks, Heather.  Hope we don't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather unhooks a box of cartridges from her belt and han it to Earl.  Suddenly there's a blood-curdling SCREAM!  T door to Pham Van's flies open.  Out staggers Melvin, wrap in Pham Van's hook-tentacle, writhing in apparent agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S GOT ME!  IT's GOT ME!  AAAAHGH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People scatter like sheep.  Burt and Heather have guns trained on him in an instant.  Then everyone realizes it' sick joke.  Melvin collapses with laughter.  Burt is livi He almost shot Melvin.  He charges over and yanks the kid his feet, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid punk!  You came that close, that close!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these days, Melvin, somebody's gonna kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pham rushes over and grabs his precious tentacle.  As peo calm down, Val and Earl gaze nervously at the vast desert before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...you fellas watch yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back with the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff, like hell.  Come back with the National Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride out to an adlib chorus:  "Keep your heads down; "Go careful, boys;" "Keep a sharp lookout;" etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl ride along, very tiny in the vast, lonely landscape, and very on edge.  Constantly looking all arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we can't possibly make Bixby by nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val doesn't want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means we're gonna be out here, like, in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resentfully) Great.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faint Country and Western radio music drifts to them. They're nearing Jim and Megan's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val knocks on the door to the mobile home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, doctor, anybody here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  He opens the door and peers inside.  Behind h Earl steps out of the half-finished house and shrugs.  No around.  Wind rustles the plastic sheeting over the windo Strangely they can still hear the muffled radio clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spooked) Oh, man, I hate this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk briskly to their horses.  Earl snatches Heather rifle from its saddle scabbard.  Val pulls out the Winchester.  Earl tries to reassure himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car's gone.  We just missed them, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where's the goddamn Conway Twitty coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They focus on the sound and walk gingerly toward it, keep constant watch in every direction.  The ground here is al torn up like the sheep pen -- and the music is coming fro underneath!  What the hell is going on? Val scrapes at the dirt with his boot -- and finds the headlight of Jim and Megan's station wagon, still on, gla up at him.  He drops down and wildly sweeps away more dir revealing more of the car's grille and hood -- and blood soaked dirt which sticks to his hand.  He leaps away, frantically rubbing the blood off on his pants. Oh, man...oh, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl are riding at full gallop.  They race alongs a concrete-lined flood-control ditch and veer off to foll barbed wire fence which crosses the ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride along the fence during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the plan...We don't even stop.  Ride like hell.  Tonight we keep right on going.  We'll walk the horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the plan...I mean, goddamn it!  What the hell are those things?  How could they bury an entire Plymouth station wagon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the horses stop short.  In a frenzy they wheel around, rear up, refusing to go on.  The cowboys fight to control them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it!  Pham Van wouldn't know a decent horse if...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Earl's already drawing his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  They got wind of something they don't like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws his rifle.  They look wildly in all directions a once -- but there's nothing, only empty desert. But I don't see anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep staring.  The horses keep pacing nervously.  Th -- Earl's horse rears wildly and falls!  Earl goes flying Val wheels around wildly, dismounts and runs to Earl, who bruised and winded but basically unhurt.  They think Earl horse just tripped. Hey, you okay?  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...yeah. (turning to the horse) What about the hor...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes bulge.  Several "snake things" have engulfed t horse's head, sucking, crushing, slurping.  Val's horse g berserk and gallops for the horizon. What in the name...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how they get you!  They're under the goddamn ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly they realize what that means -- the thing could come up under them!!  The cowboys scramble frantically aw But nothing pursues them.  They pause, glancing back nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sons of bitches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val raises his rifle and takes a well-aimed shot, hitting of them.  Orange goo spurts out.  We hear a deafening shr as all the "snake things" instantly zip back underground. Then -- A HUGE MOUND OF EARTH RISES UP UNDER VAL AND EARL The cowboys tumble down its side, Val losing his rifle. roll over and stare dumbfounded at the mound. (gasps) There must be a million of them!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mound of earth turns toward them.  The ground splits and out rises -- a huge head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awestruck) Nope...just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster is a horrendous thirty-foot long eating machi Its head is eyeless, utterly alien, covered with tough bo plates which close together to form a cork-screw point. The cowboys stumble back toward the fence in speechless terror.  The creature slides toward them, pushing through earth like a whale through water.  Now it opens its mouth but it's like a grotesque flower, boney plates spreading like petals, revealing a huge, slimy, fleshy, oozing orif And inside the mouth, a ghastly multi-tentacled tongue! These are the "snake things," not snakes at all but actua the horrid hook-tentacles that can shoot out six feet to their prey! The monster snorts and snuffs, throwing up plumes of dust sounding like a horrendous pig.  It sinks into the earth charges!  We see the hump of earth move toward them faste and faster but then it disappears as the creature goes de Val and Earl leap sideways and run along the fence.  The creature goes straight and slams into a fencepost from be All we see is the fencepost knocked at a crazy angle. The cowboys keep running.  The creature regroups and char after them, hitting each fencepost in turn, sending weird sinuous shock waves along the barbed wire, making almost musical twanging sounds.  Val looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gaining on us!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as if that weren't enough, Earl points to more troubl ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fence runs straight to the edge of the ditch, an eigh foot wide gap yawning dead ahead.  The creature churns li a locomotive from behind.  They'll have to try to jump! strain desperately for every last fraction of speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do it, we can do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leap and -- they don't do it!!  They smack into the opposite side of the ditch, clawing frantically at the li only to tumble to its sloping bottom.  A split second lat the charging creature slams like a wrecking ball into the foot-thick concrete wall!  The wall CRACKS AND BULGES OUT hook-tentacle flops out through one of the cracks!  Terri Val and Earl scramble away.  But the wall holds together. And the, strangely, all is quiet.  The tentacle lays dead still.  Eventually, the cowering cowboys dare to creep ba little closer, still panting, exhausted, jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid son of a bitch...knocked itself cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now orange slime begins to ooze through the cracks in concrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold, my ass!  It's dead!  We killed the bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly shakes his fist at the dead beast. You FUCKER!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They allow themselves a small wheeze of nervous laughter, only to jump like rabbits as some pebbles rattle loudly d the concrete wall behind them.  They whirl to see Rhonda, on the opposite side of the ditch, staring down at them. She's lugging a bunch of her equipment, including a small folding shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys, how're you doing?  Look, can I ask you something?  Did you just notice something weird? Vibrations?  You know, some kind of earth tremor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl look at each other, then burst out laughing. Rhonda spots the cracked wall. What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shattered concrete has been pulled away to fully reve the creature's horrendous head.  Start CLOSE on it: oozin blood, slavering mouth plates hanging open, hook-tentacle lolling out.  WIDEN to see Earl and Rhonda, sweating, dus and tired, staring in awe and cringing at the stench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...think it smells like that 'cause it's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see any eyes...must be totally subterranean...and those tentacles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they shoot right outta its mouth, hook you, and pull you right in.  Good thing we stopped it before it killed anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shudders) Yeah, I'm lucky it didn't find me. (overwhelmed) This is important, you know.  This is like, well, let's say it, it's probably the biggest zoological discovery of the century.  The century?  Forget it.  History.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear a shovel digging up above, and now Val shouts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it!  Here's the other end! Just look at what we caught here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl and Rhonda climb up.  CRANE UP with them to REVEAL t whole animal!  Val, digging excitedly with Rhonda's shove is just scraping away the last loose dirt from the creatu tail.  The whole length of the immense thirty foot beast partially uncovered, in king-sized bas-relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) This is one big mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is the guy that had your seismos working overtime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, stepping down to study the creature.  The body stream-lined, cigar-shaped, maybe eight feet in diameter its thickest.  It's covered with hundreds of short, rear- pointing, retractable spikes.  Rhonda gingerly jiggles on It can be pushed in and out of its socket like a plunger. It must push itself along with these.  Hundreds of them pushing at once.  That's how it can move so fast.  I mean this thing was tripping sensors all over the valley.  No wonder I couldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chilling thought stops her in mid-sentence.  She spring down into the drainage ditch to get her backpack, pulling her seismograph printouts.  She studies them frantically during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rhonda, you ever heard of anything like this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (elbows Earl) Sure, Earl, everybody knows about them.  We just didn't tell you. Come on, nobody's ever seen one of these!  We're really in on something here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys looks at each other.  One thought immediately sp to their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pham Van don't get his mitts on this for no measly fifteen bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While they bask in their fame-to-be, Rhonda continues to study the print-outs, coming to a terrifying conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the plan: we'll get a...a flatbed, I guess, with a big winch, figure a five ton anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, don't want to winch it.  That'd tear it all up.  Want to lift it. Some kind of crane with lifting straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rhonda interrupts -- now really scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, shut up!  The way I figure it.  There are five more of these things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl shut right up.  Earl edges up a fencepost. sidles up onto a rock during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda paws through her unwieldy printouts, pointing out jagged ink lines on the graphs, comparing different ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, darn it, look.  I've got seismographs all over the valley. If you compare the different readings, there have to be five. Here's one at two o'clock yesterday, but here's another one three miles away at the same time. So that's two.  Now, here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men leap from their perches and hustle her in the direction she came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take your word for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Where's your truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other side of that dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates what to most of us would be a hill, dotted huge boulders thrusting out of the sandy desert soil like mushrooms.  The trio jogs toward the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: En route to the truck, they pass near one of Rhonda's seismographs.  Suddenly Earl stumbles as one leg drops kn deep into the ground!  He screams.  Val wheels and bodily yanks him up.  They back away from the small hole in the ground, calming a little as they realize:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prairie dog burrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little sons of bitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda tenses as she hears a sound she knows well -- the scratching of the seismograph needle across its paper cylinder.  She whacks Val on the shoulder and points speechlessly at it.

dialogues.speaker: SEISMOGRAPH
dialogues.text: The needle is going wild!!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: She doesn't have to explain.  All three of them dash dash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remains of an old rail fence lay beside one of the boulders.  Val, Earl, and Rhonda scramble over the wood, onto the rock and stand there tensely. In a moment, the creature gently rustles the earth at the base of the rock.  The monster's slimy hook-tentacles sli out, searching the rock base.  Shuddering, the humans mov high as they can, well out of reach.  The tentacles slip beneath the earth.  Everyone breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least the bastard can't climb.  Pardon my French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably couldn't move too easily on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, the live ones smell worse tan the dead ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now, how far's your truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda points.  They can see the roof of her truck, maybe hundred yards away through the boulders.  Val and Earl th about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  If this one's any faster than that other one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I think we wait right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hours later.  Stiff and uncomfortable, they have not to do but theorize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing like them in the fossil record, I'm sure...Okay, so they predate the fossil record... (not buying it herself) That'd make them a couple of billion years old...and we've just never seen one till now.  Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd vote for outer space.  No way those are local boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) Atomic testing.  Or, no, bio- engineering!  The government built them, a big surprise in the next war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long pause.  Earl stares at the dirt around the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...haven't seen a sign for hours.  Maybe it's long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it is.  Why don't you take a little stroll and see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, too.  Pardon my French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've got to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val gets an idea.  He grabs a post from the dilapidated f and cautiously slips down near the boulder's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch yourself!  It's got a good six foot reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val nods.  Dead silence as he reaches way out with the po and scrapes it on the ground.  Almost instantly the creat roars up, grabbing the post in a flurry of flying dirt an lashing tentacles, nearly hooking Val's hand.  Val practically falls over himself scrambling back to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a goddamned bitch!  Been waiting there all this time.  How the hell's it even know we're still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been listening to us.  It's got no eyes.  It sure as hell can't smell anything underground, so I figure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda stares at Val, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course!  It can sense the slightest seismic vibration...hear every move we make.  Especially on this rock.  It's a perfect conductor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all settle back, having no idea what to do next.  Rh gazes out at the desert that surrounds them like an ocean I always wanted to be stuck on a desert island.  But somehow I always imagined, you know, water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes are silhouetted against a huge, spectacular, desert night sky.  After a very long pause:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I hate to be crude, but I'm gonna have to take care of some business here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic) Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just as emphatic) Same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouettes shift, Val and Earl moving down one side the rock, and Rhonda down the other.  We can no longer se them.  We just head zippers zipping down -- then soft sig of relief from Val and Earl.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Darn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
