dialogues.text: Yeah.  But I'll tell you, if you ever wanted proof God is a man, this is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rich orange sunlight creeps silently across the deathly s desert.  Earl is already awake.  Val is curled up without jacket, shivering.  He wakes with a start.  Where the hel his jacket? Rhonda wakes slowly.  She's surprised to find herself wra in Val's jacket.  Touched by his chivalry, she embarrasse hands it to baffled Val.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val glances at Earl, who looks away.  Who, me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rhonda) No problem.  Anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl gropes through his pockets, coming up with only cigarettes.  Val fishes in his own pockets, finding only their lighter.  They exchange items and light up during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, folks, what's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First let's see if Stumpy's still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time he tosses a piece of wood out onto the sand.  W soft rustling, a bulge forms in the earth, moves over to wood, then subsides.  Rhonda starts looking around during

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't he have a home to go to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) Well, that's why Edgar never got down off that tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have an idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her) We're gonna have to come up with some kind of plan or it's just gonna wait us to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was wondering if we could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's just run for it.  We outran that one yesterday, at least on a sprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda gives up on them.  She goes over and pulls a long cross rail from the fence during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run for it?  Running's not a plan. Running is what you do when the plan fails.  You're not even trying to come up with a plan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not like we've got a hell of a lot of options...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You guys know how to pole vault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch in surprise as she hefts her pole, checks the balance, eyeballs the distance to the nearest boulder.  T she charges between them, plants her pole and vaults smoo over to the next boulder, maybe fifteen feet away.  The creature surfaces where her pole touched down, but too la -- a hook tentacle vainly sweeps the area, the disappears into the ground.  Val and Earl glance at each other, impressed. We just stay where it can't get us...on these residual boulders. My truck's parked right next to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl rushes to grab a couple more fence rails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on those residual boulders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val just stands staring across at Rhonda -- his horizons broadening.  Earl stuffs a fence rail into his hands. (pointedly) Tammy Lynn Baxter, she do a lot of pole-vaulting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl takes a deep breath and goes for it, vaulting across Rhonda.  Val follows.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Through the shimmering heat in the distance we see the strange sight of the three figures vaulting from boulder boulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Earl and Rhonda pole-vault their way toward the truc Finally they're at the nearest boulder, but the truck is still ten feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it's still following us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's assume that it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once we hit that truck we gotta go fast.  I say we all jump together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda and Val nod.  Rhonda grips her car keys in her tee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth) Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  One, two, three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all vault in unison, landing in the truck bed.  Rhon scrambles up, slides open the cab's rear window, and begi wriggling through headfirst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Come on, girl, it ain't gonna give us much time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust explodes around the rear of the truck!  Hook-tentacl snake up on all sides, narrowly missing Val.  He and Earl grab whatever's handy, pounding at the tentacles with expensive instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO!  GO!  GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda's only half way through the cab window, still hang headfirst into the cab.  She frantically starts the truck dives down and punches the accelerator with her fist. As the truck roars away, one tentacles manages to tear of the muffler.  The engine thunders like a tank.  Val and E sit back, sighing in relief, then react when they see Rhonda is driving upside down and blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda skids her noisy truck to a halt in front of Pham V

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better get everybody together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val leaps out and jumps into his pick-up truck.  He searc for the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go north, I'll go south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val holds out his hand for the key.  Earl tosses it to hi Val drives off.  We FOLLOW Rhonda and Earl as they drive other way, toward Viola's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you're sorry the college ever sent you up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm scared, but I'm not sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Val went to that college, too.  For a whole year.  Couldn't quite sit still for it, though. Had too much vinegar in his system. But once he settles down, forgets this cowboy stuff, he'll be one in a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda sees straight through Earl's clumsy attempt at mat making.  She can't help but smile.  Earl grins sheepishly All right, I'm about as subtle as a donkey's ass.  Pardon my French. I'm just saying the boy's got potential, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE IN on Rhonda -- her and Val?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestor, Viola, Nancy, and Miguel nervously crowd around V Earl, and Rhonda.  Viola holds her yappy dog which perio- dically snarls and snaps at people.  Pham Van is on his C radio trying to contact Burt and Heather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious, Val?  You think we're not even safe here in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me that after you meet one.  I think we should all get the hell out while the getting's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not just take a Number Ten pick axe and give it one good whack...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestor, damn it, these things are bigger than an Airstream trailer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I've got to find Mindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Pham, where's Burt and Heather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs up CB) Can't raise them.  I guess they're still out there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've got a radio, why aren't you calling somebody in Bixby?  The police or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't reach outside the valley. You know, because of the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rhonda, what's the name you call those things, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a scientist, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have a theory at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, these things are absolutely unprecedented!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but where'd they come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Where'd they come from?  Okay, worms, probably in the Jurassic period.  Cosmic radiation was much higher then...so they mutated...and they got so big they just sank right into the ground and fell asleep... But now continental drift has brought them to the surface, ready to be harvested by the ancient alien meat growers who planted them here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody stares at her, then they smile, realizing she's pulling their legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, don't matter where they come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  We need to be talking about what we're gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness, Valentine, once they see the road is out and the phone lines are down, someone will be along to look in on us.  Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the utility truck still parked near the landslide blocking the road.  REVEAL, on the far side, a telephone maintenance truck is now parked, emergency lights flashin and nearby, amid phoneworkers' climbing and repair gear, more hard hats lying on blood-soaked ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is still jabbering away.  Rhonda speak over the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no, they listen!  They can sense the slightest vibration through the ground.  That's how they see!  That's how they hunt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, like we don't vibrate, right? Maybe they won't even come to here, huh?  Maybe they leave us alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val shakes his head, and marches over to the topographic on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They caught up with Edgar here. They grabbed Old Fred here.  They nailed the asshole dog here.  And the doctor's place is here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spots he indicates describe a line leading along the valley straight toward town. This valley's just one long smorgasbord and if we don't haul ass outta here we're the next course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear an a eerie SHRIEK from outside.  Something shoots through the window, striking Earl in the chest!!  Earl fl frantically at it -- but it's only Melvin's basketball. glimpse Melvin outside, doubled over with laughter.  Earl grabs the ball and hurls it viciously back, but Melvin ea dodges it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little ass wipe!  You knock that off or you're gonna be shitting that basketball!  Pardon my French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Val) Now, Val, let's assume they're as dangerous as you say.  Where are we going to go that's safer than right here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda's got an idea about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, see, they move very easily through the Pleistocene Alluvials... (off their blank looks) ...the dirt...the loose soil that makes up the valley floor.  But they can't move through solid rock. I think we should travel west to the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, up the jeep trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mountains are solid granite. We'd be safe there, and we could hike along them...all the way to Bixby if we have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy rushes back toward Pham Van's, still looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindy!  Mindy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're CLOSE on Melvin as he circles around the back of Ph Van's, bouncing his basketball, mischief in his eyes.  We hear the townsfolk inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Valentine, I'm not leaving my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's gonna take us days to get back with help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doggone it, Viola, it's just plain crazy to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, to Melvin's astonishment, the steady rhythm of his bouncing basketball suddenly stops.  The ball just goes f and doesn't bounce back up to him.  He looks down.  No ba Just swirling dust at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone jumps as we once more hear an ear-shattering SHR from Melvin.  Earl snarls and heads for the door, Val rig behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kick his ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl are well ahead of the other townsfolk as the march around to the side of Pham Van's.  But where's Melv Nothing out here but the oppressive, hot desert silence. Then they hear a soft shuddering whimper -- from above. There's terrified Melvin, halfway up a telephone pole, clinging to it desperately. Val and Earl freeze in their tracks and glance at each other, realizing instantly what's up.  Without a word the leap desperately in opposite directions.  Like a breachin whale, a creature roars up through the earth right where were standing, great mouth gaping open, slimy tentacles lashing in all directions. The townsfolk scatter, some heading for their homes, including Viola and Nestor.  Others scramble over each ot as they pile back into Pham Van's.  The telephone pole shudders.  Melvin falls and scampers for the nearest hidi place, a corrugated tin storage shed near Pham Van's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Earl, Rhonda, Miguel, and Pham Van rush in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!  Man, you gut a gun?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big as a house!  What are we gonna do...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!  QUIET!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Pham shut up.  Then we hear something new -- t building itself creaking and groaning like a ship.  The liquor bottles behind Pham Van's bar vibrate and clink. creature is moving beneath the building.  The people free like mannequins.  Now we can hear its pig-like snorting. Pham Van and Miguel react as the awful smell percolates u through the floorboards.  Val signals them to keep quiet. Finally, the creaking stops. Rhonda addresses the group in an intense whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember...no noise.  No vibration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stands stock still -- and sweats.  But, then, sl we become aware of a faint, yet oddly familiar sound. Squeak, squeak, squeak -- Mindy on her pogo stick!  They scramble to the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is, alone in the vacant street, Walkman blaring her ears, merrily bouncing along to a rock 'n' roll beat.

dialogues.speaker: PHAM VAN'S STORE
dialogues.text: Thoughts of personal safety vanish as the horrified peopl lean way out the doors and windows and shout with one voi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad lib) MINDY! Get off your pogo stick! Get in here, girl! Run, Mindy!

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: She can't hear them over her Walkman.  A tell-tale puff o dust spurts up not fifty feet from her!

dialogues.speaker: PHAM VAN'S STORE
dialogues.text: Val sees Mindy has only seconds left!  He vaults straight the window and charges toward her!  Right behind him come Earl and Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: As she rounds a corner at the opposite end of town.  She spots Mindy, then sees Val running.  She starts running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindy!  Mindy!

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: She's lazily bouncing in circles -- squeak, squeak, squea She goes wide-eyed as she rotates to see Val coming at he like a mad bull, arms outstretched.  The asphalt under he pogo stick cracks and -- Val tackles her, both of them tumbling head over heels. scrambles up, rubbing her skinned elbow and yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oww!  Val, you hurt me...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val claps his hand over her mouth.  She goes wide eyed as sees: her pogo stick standing straight up in the cracked asphalt!  Then it is sucked down like so much spaghetti! Nancy rushes into frame, hugging Mindy.  Val signals her be quiet.  They sit uneasily.  Where's the creature? Suddenly the pogo stick erupts out of the earth right in their midst! Val runs one way, Nancy and Mindy the other, heading up t street toward their house.  Val scrambles up onto his pic truck!  The creature rams the truck, rupturing a tire.  A shakes the truck violently, Val spots Rhonda and Earl, no standing uncertainly halfway between him and Pham Van's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back, for chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda and Earl hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get him off there.  It'll suck that truck down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Earl now hears something behind them!  Down the stree a little wall of cinder blocks framing Viola's driveway suddenly topples over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.  Rhonda, another one!

dialogues.speaker: LOW CAMERA
dialogues.text: CAMERA charges toward them.  Earl swerves toward Pham Van but Rhonda is cut off!  She heads toward the next nearest haven:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storage shed where Melvin is hiding.  It sits in a vacant, weed-choked lot.  Crashing through the weeds, Rho has almost reached the shed when she is suddenly brought short and slams face down in a cloud of dust! She can't get up!!  Something's got her!  She's caught in old rusted barbed wire fence, lying almost flat, hidden i the weeds.  Some strands have come loose and are curled u like vicious concertina wire. Barely has she taken this in when -- the ground caves in under her!  She rolls wildly to one side as hook-tentacle snake up, missing her by inches!  She keeps rolling-crawl scrambling -- anything to get away from the awful maw -- gets her legs hopelessly tangled in the barbed wire.  She freezes.  The creature feels around where she was. She calms herself, pulling gingerly at the wire, working tensely to free herself but -- The creature's mouth slams shut on the fence.  Like a spi sensing something caught in its web, the monster knows it on to something.  Its hook-tentacles shoot forward to sna three feet of fence, then the creature lunges up and out, swallowing that three feet in a big "gulp" and yanking Rh violently toward it!  She screams, pants ripped, legs sla and bleeding!  GULP!  She's dragged even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck shakes and shimmies as Val's creature tries to it down.  Val sees that Rhonda's in trouble.  He searches frantically for a weapon -- and finds one -- a CHAIN SAW! leaps as far from the truck as he can and hits the ground running, yanking furiously on the saw's starter cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda is in a dead panic, thrashing helplessly in the ba wire.  The beast takes another gulp of fence, wrenching h within inches of a probing hook-tentacle!  Suddenly we he nasty ROAR as Val's chain saw swings in, slicing the squi ing tentacle in half, spraying gore everywhere!  The crea unleashes an unearthly shriek, and the other tentacles recoil.  The severed one writhes like a beheaded snake. Val yanks off Rhonda's boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Outta your pants!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She frantically claws at her belt.  But in mere seconds:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) LOOK OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tentacles snake out to regain their grip on the fence.  V grabs the saw and starts slashing wildly, but this time t hook-tentacles snag it and wrench it from his grasp.  It slams to the ground, motor dying.  The monster readies it for the lunge that will suck Rhonda in.  Val grabs her un the arms and pulls.  Rhonda wriggles wildly to get out of wire enmeshed pants. The creature lunges!  Rhonda pulls free!  She and Val tum backward.  The creature gets only a mouthful of Rhonda's The next instant the second creature explodes up through ground right next to fallen Val and Rhonda!  They roll sideways, come up running, and sprint for Pham Van's alon old wooden sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl flings open the front door.  Val and Rhonda race tow the porch.  Right on their heels the creature ripples the boards like an ocean wave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Come on!  Don't look back! Just run!  Run like screaming fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dive through the open door of Pham Van's.  The rippl boards zoom on past it.  Earl quickly eases the door shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl turns to breathless Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Pardon my French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tense, edgy group.  Every movement made is in slow motion, every word is a whisper.   They gaze grimly out t windows at the silent, deserted, heat-shimmering main str Val gingerly dabs iodine onto the cuts on Rhonda's legs. She doesn't even wince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paying attention?  This oughta hurt like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him. So, is that one of your usual jobs, saving peoples' lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) First time for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes at him.  He looks away.  Over at the bar, Pham holds up a new pair of pants for Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grateful for something to do, Val eases over to get the pants.  Rhonda looks after him.  Then she becomes aware o someone staring at her.  It's Earl, giving her a big Ches cat grin that says "What did I tell you?" Pham hands the pants to Val.  Then Pham and Miguel reach simultaneously for a sods bottle and -- knock it over!  I rolls all the way down the bar as a flurry of desperate h try to stop it.  No good.  It rolls off the end and -- CR Everyone freezes.  Sure enough the building shudders.  Fl boards creak and bend as searching tentacles thump and sc along under the floor.  People close their eyes, not even breathing.  Finally the noise subsides.  Everyone relaxes a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we gonna do, you know? How long till they go away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) They got the patience of Job.  They just sit and goddamn wait til they hear something that sounds like lunch.  We need a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a plan.  You and Val take your truck, get to the mountains. Hike to Bixby.  Get us some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those scumsuckers are my radials, Pham!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can take my truck then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good.  You need major four- wheel-drive just to get up that jeep trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all shut up when they hear Viola's dog yapping in th distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the hill across from Pham Van's, the old trailer looks perfectly peaceful.  Except Viola's dog keeps yapping.  T we hear panicked Viola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!  Quiet you hateful thing...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it up!  Shut the little bastard up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck him out the door!  Like a little hors d'oeuvre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a loud whap!  The dog's bark simply changes to piercing yelps.  It would be funny except -- The trailer suddenly bucks upward, hit from below as thou by a pile driver!  Again and again the unseen creatures s into the frail structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away!  Get away!  Oh God in heaven, help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer is finally knocked right off its foundation! tips over and tumbles all the way down the hill!  As the clears, all is silent.  A huge hole is torn in the traile floor.  Viola's possessions are scattered everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitchin' lowlife, putrid, scum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta do something.  Gotta get the bastards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeless) Man, what the hell can we do to those things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're sure as hell not going to sit here being quiet for God knows how long.  Are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute, Earl.  I got enough food here to last us for weeks.  Those damn things can't wait around forever. (pause) We can do it.  I mean, if we have to, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns away from the windows, gingerly sitting do glumly pondering this possibility.  There is a long silen Then suddenly -- ROAR!  The silence is shattered as Pham Van's big freezer compressor suddenly comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  Shut it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pham runs to the freezer.  Its on/off switch is buried be stacks of soft-drink cases.  He tears at them like a madm toppling them this way and that.  Earl and Val join him. But right behind Pham, the floor BUCKLES UP, a monster's snout BURSTING THROUGH and engulfing one of his legs!  Th creature starts to back down into the jagged hole, draggi screaming Pham with it.  Val, Earl, Rhonda, and Miguel gr Pham's arms but are no match for the monster.  It shakes spins him like some gigantic dog, effortlessly throwing t off, relentlessly pulling Pham down. The hole in the floor is too small for Pham to fit throug As one leg goes down, the other is bent hideously backwar Pham screams and screams as jagged wood tears into him, b snap, ribs crack.  The others grab him again but are utte helpless.  With vicious, powerful jerks the creature yank his man mangled body down.  The last thing we see is his now folded back past his head, and he's gone. Val is wild with helpless anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!  Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor bulges up in another place!  A second creature! Then a third, coming RIGHT UP UNDER THEM!  Earl sprawls o the bar.  Rhonda springs onto the shelves in the middle o store, knocking groceries everywhere.  Val and Miguel cli shelves which cover the rear wall of the store. The whole building shakes and shudders, dust powdering do from the ceiling.  Flailing tentacles are everywhere, slashing open food packages; clouds of flour fill the air Val spots a hatch in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody!  This way!  The roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl leaps from the bar to the rear shelves.  Val and Mig slide sideways till they're beneath the hatch, then use t shelves as a ladder, climbing up to the hatch.  Val pound it frantically. In the middle of the store, Rhonda leaps from shelf to sh trying to get closer to where Val is.  Soon she reaches t last one, balancing precariously.  But a creature tips ov the first one!  The shelves topple like dominoes, crashin toward Rhonda.  She is half catapulted, half jumps right through an open window, ripping through the screen. Val sees what's happened.  With maniacal strength he smas open the hatch and climbs out onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val rushes to the edge of the roof shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda!  Keep moving.  Don't stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down where Rhonda fell.  She's not there.  He he a whistle and is relieved to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda is perched as high as she can get on the water tow near Pham Van's.  It's maybe twenty-five feet tall, a sim wood frame holding a big galvanized tank.  The wooden leg stand on big concrete anchors buried in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin peers terrified out the shed door, up at the guys Pham Van's roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  What's going on, man?!  What the hell you doing up there...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin, shut the hell up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late.  Wham!  A creature strikes.  The little sh shudders, dust puffing from every old seam.  In a split second Melvin has climbed to the shed roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Mindy peer to the window, surprised to see the on Pham Van's roof.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: We hear Val's shouting to the remaining townsfolk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy!  Nestor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up on your roof!  On your roof! They can come through the floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store shakes and shimmies.  We hear the monster's thunderous crashing from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you shout a little quieter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather's place, about a mile from town, is no- nonsense, functional, ugly -- unpainted concrete walls, n yard, chain-link fence.  Burt and Heather drive up in the big Blazer and park right beside the house.  Hot and tire they climb out, each carrying a heavy, scoped hunting rif Burt peers toward Perfection through binoculars during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it.  No tracks, no sign, no spoor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever they are, you'd think after they ate all those sheep they'd have to take a dump someplace... (reacts to what he sees) What the hell's going on in town?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The town is a very strange sight.  It's as though an invisible flood were in progress, driving people to high ground.  We see: Rhonda perched on the water tower; Val, and Miguel on the store roof; Nancy and Mindy on their ro Melvin on the storage shed; Nestor on his roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Earl and Miguel gaze out at the town, trying to conc a plan.   Suddenly Earl perks up.  The men speak softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, here's the plan: Nestor's Cadillac.  His tires are nine hundred sixteens.  We sprint for it, grab the spare, put it on our truck with our spare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val stares at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell long it take you to change a tire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Just about too damn long.  Bolt pattern's probably wrong anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need another plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, down in the store, Pham Van's CB radio squawks loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, P.V., Burt here.  Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building shudders as the creatures again smash throug the floor inside, looking for the source of the noise.  V Earl and Miguel scramble to the edge of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CB radio sits on a shelf near an open window.  Tentac are feeling along the wall just below it.  Val appears ou side the window -- upside-down.  He snatches the radio an hauled straight up out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pham?  Anybody copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Earl haul Val by the feet back up onto the roo Val quickly turns down the CB volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers into mic) Burt, now listen.  We found out what's been killing people.  Over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A peculiar cross between bomb shelter and blue-collar den Burt's wood-paneled basement has all the comforts for pos Apocalypse living.  Burt talks on his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative copy on that, Pham, check your frequency.  I'm on forty-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little louder) Burt, can you hear me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just barely, Pham.  What are you all doing up on your roofs. What the hell's going on?  Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few feet away Heather works at their ammunition reloadi bench.  She dumps a few hundred empty cartridge cases int case cleaner and switches it on.  It HUMS loudly as it vibrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The groping tentacles swiftly suck back below the floor. TILT UP to see out the window some distance away, a coupl old trash cans topple over as the creature streaks past beneath them, making a bee-line for Burt's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel points frantically at the trash cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, they're going, man!  I think they're going for Burt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val talks a little louder into the mic.  INTERCUT as need

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt!  This is Val!  Get out of your basement!!  Take your radio! You and Heather get up on your roof!  Then we'll talk, okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val?  What the hell you doing back already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Burt, get out!  Get up on your roof or someplace!  We found out what's been killing people!  They're under the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's under the ground?  We're not getting up on the roof.  Earth shelter's the best.  Known that since I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen!  Listen!  We know what they are!  They're big things under the ground!  Much bigger than we thought!  They're coming after you! They're coming right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing that warning, Burt and Heather go into a well-hon drill.  They grab their hunting rifles and take positions basement windows.  Burt scans with the binoculars.  He se nothing.  He glances at Heather.  She shrugs.  Nobody com

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) We don't see anything, Val.  Now what the hell are you talking about?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is frantic.  How do you explain these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming underground!  They ...they can dig like a son of a bitch...Big monsters under the ground, Burt!  Now get the hell out!  Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather exchange looks.  Has Val gone nuts?  The they hear a low RUMBLE, growing louder and louder.  Tools hanging over the work bench start to shake; the decorativ cow skulls on the wall rattle; the overhead lights sway - and then -- everything stops.  Dead silence, except for t humming of the case cleaner. THEN THE WALL MOVES!!  The wood paneling bulges slightly. Nails pop out.  The wall is pushed again; the paneling cracks.  A cow skull falls.  Burt and Heather level their rifles and -- A huge creature pushes right through the wall!  Fully hal its bulbous, spiked body writhes into the center of the room, great multi-part jaws drooling open, hook-tentacles lashing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men can hear the chaos over the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Chri...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CB goes dead.  The men stare numbly.  Then, drifting across the desert, a soft popping sound.  The men perk up they know what it is -- distant gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunfire is DEAFENING as Burt and Heather blast away. Globby blood spurts from a dozen wounds, and the creature pulls back a little.  The couple keeps firing until magaz are empty.  The creature lunges forward again. PAN with Burt and Heather to REVEAL a wall of the basemen haven't seen until now -- a wall covered with guns -- han guns, long guns, riot guns, flare guns, antique guns, military guns, elephant guns. Heather grabs an HK-91 assault rifle, slams in two magazi bottoms taped end to end, and opens fire!  A hook-tentacl snags her boot, yanking her right off her feet.  Burt pum out eight devastating blasts from a twelve-gauge riot gun severing the tentacle.  Heather is on her feet in an inst She expertly flops her double magazine over, loading the one taped upside-down to it, and opens fire again.  Burt grabs an AR-15 semi-auto and joins her.  They lay down massive fire, virtually disappearing in muzzle flash and smoke.  Ejected shell cases clatter and clang all around room. The guns are empty.  THE CREATURE IS STILL COMING!  They down the wall, desperately grabbing weapons one after another: a lever-action, a magnum handgun, even a flare g which Heather fires right into the creature's mouth. Shrieking in pain, the horrid thing thing KEEPS WRIGGLING

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD THEM
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather scramble up over a desk to keep somethin between them and it.  Burt smashes open a fancy glass cas holding a huge four-gauge elephant gun.  He slams in two gigantic cartridges nearly an inch in diameter.  He fires The concussion literally shakes the building.  The recoil slams Burt back against the wall. The monster bullets tear monster holes in the monster.  G gouts of curdles blood spew from it -- Burt hit an artery something.  The beast convulses grotesquely, then collaps deflating like a beached whale.  Burt and Heather stagger together and hug each other fervently.  They stare dumbfo at the massive dead horror.  Burt suddenly shouts vehemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broke into the wrong goddamn rec room, didn't you, you BASTARD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Earl and Miguel listen to the silence hoping for som sign that their friends are alive.  Suddenly: We killed it!  You got that?  We killed that motherfucker!  Come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a moment for this to sink in, then the men CHEER as quietly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...roger that, Burt.  Uh, congratulations.  Uh, be advised, however, there are four more, repeat, four more motherfuckers. Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather dash out onto the roof, laden with weapo ammo boxes and their CB radio.  They hit the deck, assort rifles and the elephant gun the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val shouts to everyone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got one!  They killed one of the sons of bitches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin pumps his fist in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, dudes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Mindy hug each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perched on his Spanish tile roof, Nestor pours coffee fro his thermos and raises his cup in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda lets out a WHOOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men sit, temporarily jubilant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess we don't get to make fun of Burt's lifestyle anymore, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val grabs the CB mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt, any chance you can get the rest of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather peer from their fortress-like roof.  Bur spots earth bulging up near the foundation of his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) One second, Val.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the elephant gun and takes two well-aimed shots two deafening BOOMS which echo off the distant mountains. But the bullets bury themselves harmlessly in the dirt. bulge in the dirt moves calmly away and sinks from view. Heather shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not getting any penetration, even with the elephant gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! (into CB) Val, we can't get them.  Never figured on having to shoot through dirt!  Best goddamn bullet stop there is.  Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are disappointed.  That's not what they wanted to hear from Burt.  Then Earl perks up and grab the CB mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) Okay, Burt, listen.  Forget shooting them.  Tell me this: can you get to your truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  You've got the only truck in the valley that can make it up that damn jeep trail.  So, here's the plan: You and Heather go for help. Get to the mountains...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rhonda interrupts, pointing urgently from the water tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys!  They're up to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Earl and Miguel rush to the edge of the roof and loo down where she's pointing -- A creature is running its tentacles along the building's foundation.  It's a strange, more studied movement than w seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rhonda) What's it doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you all keep asking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stare nervously down as the tentacles feel their along the wall, moving toward a corner of the building. Suddenly Miguel spots something down the next wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there's another one coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another set of tentacles is feeling along the adjacent wa The two creatures meet at the corner, their tentacles tou ing rather like ants' antennae.  They they submerge; tent cles zipping into the earth.  Nothing happens for a momen Then the corner of the building suddenly heaves up a coup of feet.  Clapboard siding splits.  A warped window shatt (We don't see the creatures, only the effect of their sho from below).  The men nearly lose their balance.  Then th corner sinks back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Mindy are still huddled on the roof.  They don' make a sound.  They're startled when the house suddenly groans and tilts as creatures give it a tentative shove. Nancy and Mindy frantically cling to the peak of the smoo roof.  The picture windows shatters.  We hear beams POP a CRACK, dishes CRASH off shelves.  The front screen door swings open.  At last the house slowly settles back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are watching Nancy's house tensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't making no noise. Why they bothering them for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mind racing) They're studying the buildings... trying to figure them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda chimes in from the water tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're confused.  They can feel our vibrations, but they can't find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're working together, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like they got a plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaker there, Earl.  What do you want us to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) Hang on, Burt.  The bastards are up to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straddling the peak of his steeply sloping roof.  Nestor grabs on in panic as the creatures lift the place up slow The roof warps, Spanish tiles shatter and rain down on th ground. This causes a flurry of activity.  Tentacles snake around where the tiles fell.  We hear creatures crash through inside, snorting and huffing.  They attack the house in earnest, shaking it violently, pushing the front wall out till it falls flat.  The roof collapses on that side!  Ne can't hang on!  He slides all the way down, landing acros window on the flattened wall.  The next instant he's grab and pulled through the window, right into the ground.  He

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMS
dialogues.text: DOLLY along the ground, heading toward the storage shed w Melvin is.  All we can see is dirt, but we can still hear Nestor screaming UNDERGROUND!  His screams get more and m faint as DOLLY ENDS on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON horrified Melvin as he rocks back and forth autistically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow, man!  No way!  No fucking way, man...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy comforts Mindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Earl and Miguel stare in horror and disbelief.  Migu crosses himself.  They're in worse trouble than they thou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knocked his place down on purpose, man.  They're gonna tear this whole town out from under us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather's truck is parked in foreground.  The co is up on the roof in background.  Burt prowls along the e of the roof with the elephant gun.  Heather mans the C.B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt!  Heather!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Val.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in deep shit over here. Let's change that plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hump of dirt raises near the base of the house.  Burt j the rifle to his shoulder and squeezes off a shot.  The h moves away from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off, Burt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I scared it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget going for help.  We'll all be dead long before you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still moving away, the hump of dirt passes under the side walk, rippling the flagstones gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) We're here, Val.  Just tell us what you need.  Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're tearing down the houses here!  We all gotta get outta here together!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hump of dirt passes under Burt and Heather's truck, rocking the vehicle slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're with you, Val.  We'll come get everybody.  Just hang on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck's security alarm starts BOOPING!  Burt and Heat stare down helplessly as the noisy truck is furiously attacked by the frenzied creatures.  Dust flies as metal and tires shred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val Earl and Miguel listen in disbelief to the distant tr alarm.  It finally sputters and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, we're going to have to forget about the truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) Yeah, Heather, we got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've hit rock-bottom.  They sit in helpless, desperate silence. Over on the storage shed roof, Melvin is losing it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you better think of something, man!  You gotta do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Val, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel nods in agreement.  Val and Earl stare at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!!  Since when the hell's every goddamn thing up to us?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) You guys do all the odd jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val just stares at her. Then -- CRASH!  The store shudders, creaks, and groans. creatures are back.  One corner of the store lifts up, be splintering.  Then another corner lifts up!  The roof til like the deck of a storm-tossed ship.  From now on the monsters shake and ram the building almost constantly. Hanging on tight, the men peer over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a hell of a lot of time here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Rhonda tries her desperate best to be logical:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the situation hasn't changed. We still have to get to solid rock. There must be some way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts, angry) Like what?!  There's nothing left that'll make it to the mountains!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Val, quiet, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a helicopter is what we need, or a goddamn tank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...the Cat.  Could we take the Cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubious) Jesus.  It's slower than hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it weighs better than thirty tons.  No way they could stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't all fit on that bulldozer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Val is warming to the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...we could pull something!  We could, I don't know, drag a car behind it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car, huh?  Like a big armored car?  Need something bigger, tougher...our truck maybe...or, hell, that old semi trailer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its tires are flat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter.  The cat can pull anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...all right!  We just roll on out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a plan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They squint at the bulldozer -- 'way in the distance. 'Course, that's one helluva long walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare grimly, momentarily stuck for an idea.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, they only respond to vibration, right?  Couldn't we... distract them somehow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, good!  Something to keep them busy.  We need a decoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Melvin, you wanna make a buck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel grabs Earl and points down at little garden tracto a jumble of Pham Van's equipment and tools near the side the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how about the tractor?  Start him up.  Let him go by itself.  Let those things chase it all over is they like that noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Not bad. (to Val) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store takes a heavy hit.  The front porch collapses w a terrific crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the ground's getting closer.  I think we do it.  We're gonna save our asses here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  How are you going to know they're all following it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got two right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val scrambles to the highest point of the sagging roof an shouts to Nancy. Nancy, we gotta find all four of them.  How many you got over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house shuddering and shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one.  I think one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl grabs the CB mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) Burt, Heather, we got a little sort of a plan going here, maybe.  Can you tell if you've still got any of those things out at your place? Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB) Yeah, still got one poking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's four.  Let us know if it starts moving, Burt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl have lowered Miguel down to a window sill ri above the garden tractor.  He has used his kerchief to ti the steering wheel to keep the front wheels straight.  He jams the throttle open and signals thumbs-up to Val and E above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl stride purposefully toward the opposite end the roof.  Realizing they have the same idea, each one tr to edge ahead of the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making the run to the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get real.  I'm faster than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm best at driving the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if something happens to me. Look, you'd better listen.  I'm older and wiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you're half right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl raises a fist: The Challenge.  They do scissors-rock paper.  One, two, three.  Val loses. Damn.  Guess I have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I won.  I pick who does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val glares at him.  Earl's obviously determined. Ready when you are, Miguel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl positions himself, nervous as hell, ready to leap at right moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel leans out precariously and pulls the tractor's sta cord.  Nothing.  On the second try it starts.  He slams i into gear and sends it out toward open desert.  The store shakes under Miguel, almost knocking him off the window s as two humps of dirt pursue the noisy tractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they go!  They're chasing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "spout" of dust erupts near the foundation as the creat beneath zooms away toward the new sound.  Nancy whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going... (then shouts) There goes this one!  It's going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CB radio squawks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this guy just took off like a shot.  What'd you people do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl is poised to leap.  Val steps up and slaps him on th back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your ass, shithead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me, jerkoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val instantly elbows Earl hard in the stomach.  As Earl doubles over, Val springs off the edge of the roof. You goddamn suicidal son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Val running for all he's worth -- and there's the bulldozer at the edge of town a long way away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW CAMERA pursues the garden tractor as it bounces along

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val charges across the vast open area that separates him the bulldozer.  We can hear the tractor droning along in background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tractor suddenly takes a bad bounce and flips over! engine dies.  Total silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl, Rhonda and Miguel have seen the tractor take a head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val's crunching boots seem incredibly loud in the sudden silence.  He hesitates, glancing over his shoulder.  He's totally out in the open, halfway to the bulldozer.  Shoul run back or go forward?  He decides to go for the bulldoz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four creatures are now heading for Val.  INTERCUT fou slightly different LOW CAMERA ANGLES speeding over the ground, racing after him.  He strains to the limit, breat coming in painful rasps -- but the creatures are closing on him with chilling ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never make it!  They're gonna get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells) VAL, STOP!  THEY'RE COMING!  DON'T MOVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val hears her and stops dead.  So do the creatures.  Mayb twenty feet away, their giant snouts poke up out of the ground: one, two, three, four.  Val stands trembling.  Th creatures softly shuffle back and forth, searching blindl for him, hook-tentacles feeling everywhere.  One tentacle sweeps toward Val's boot.  He manages to lift his foot ju in time, letting the tentacle pass beneath it.  He balanc precariously like a flamingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked!  They can't find him! (pause) Okay, okay...uh...we gotta make some noise...a lot of noise!  HEY, YOU SORRY SONS OF BITCHES, COME AND GET ME...!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts jumping noisily up and down.  Miguel joins in, cursing the monsters in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda kicks and shouts.  But it's obvious they need some thing louder.  She spots the aging outlet pipe coming fro the water tank.  Bracing herself, she kicks at it with bo feet.  It finally gives way at a rusted joint.  A torrent water blasts out, thundering into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the creatures wheel about in the dirt and zoom off to town.  Val breathes a big sigh of relief and sprints to t bulldozer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That did it, girl!  Goddamn good thinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mass of tentacles and snouts swirl through the big pudd where the water if falling.  The creatures' breathing thr up spouts of muddy water.  Rhonda looks down nervously. calls reassuringly from Pham Van's:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  No way they can lift that tower.  I mean it's really heavy.

dialogues.speaker: CONCRETE FOOTING
dialogues.text: The dirt begins to cave in around the tower's footing.  T creatures are digging the dirt away!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The water tower tilts ever so slightly, creaking and groaning!  Rhonda frantically grabs a handhold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not trying to lift it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val lands in the driver's seat and turns the engine over it doesn't start!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO FUCKING WAY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old machine starts.  Val slams it into reverse and ba up toward the semi trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water tower is starting to tilt seriously.  Water spi over the top edge of the tank, drenching Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val has used heavy chains on the back of the bulldozer to jerry-rig a hitch to the semi trailer.   Now he scrambles back into the driver's seat.  He guns the engine, wrenchi the old semi trailer from years of dried mud and tumblewe Ancient tires disintegrate.  Rusted wheels screech and complain -- but it moves.  Val lets out a whoop and heads full-tilt for town.  He's suddenly shocked as he sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda's in big trouble.  She scrambles to the high side the tower platform.  The tower's going to tip over at any moment!  It's roof slides off and crashes into the street On Pham Van's, Miguel and Earl are tearing apart the swam cooler, throwing pieces of it off the roof, trying to distract the creatures, but they can't compete with the n from the water. In BG the bulldozer rumbles toward the tower at top speed an excruciatingly slow eight miles per hour. The tremendously heavy water tank suddenly tears loose, sliding off its platform, nearly carrying Rhonda with it. She ends up hanging from a cross beam as the water tank splatters like an enormous egg below, sending a small tid wave down the street. The remains of the tower tilt crazily nearly forty-five degrees.  The bulldozer grinds closer and closer.  Rhonda tries to climb up, but the jostling and shuddering of the tower keeps her dangling precariously.  Suddenly she fall And lands in the dirt.  The creatures zero in on her!  Sh turns wildly and leaps for the blade of the approaching bulldozer.  The blade is only inches off the ground but V swiftly raises it, lifting Rhonda high into the air just above the grasping tentacles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rhonda climbs down into the cab, Val heads the bulldoz over to Pham Van's and stops.  Almost as soon as he does, creatures attack, a frenzy of tentacles grabbing at all s of the massive earth-moving machine, slithering into the treads.  Val and Rhonda watch this nervously as Earl and Miguel quickly clamber from the roof down into the protec steel belly of the semi trailer. Val mentally crosses his fingers and sends the bulldozer roaring forward.  It effortlessly tears loose from the tentacles, grinding one to pulp in its treads.  The creat shrieks in pain.  The humans cheer!  At last they've got upper hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin dances merrily, and noisily, on the metal rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go!  Dumb fucking worms! Now haul ass over here, man!  Me next!  Get me off of here...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flimsy shed seems almost to explode as a furious crea roars up inside.  The walls buckle out.  The whole struct sags.  Melvin scrambles to peak of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!  Oh, God!  Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the unseen creature thrashes around inside the shed, t walls topple outward and the roof drops to the ground lik pancake.  Melvin has lost all self control and just keeps screaming.  Val pulls along side, jumps down onto the tre and reaches out to Melvin.  But just as they join hands, creature hits the roof from beneath, dragging it several feet.  Val is yanked off the bulldozer and lands with Nel on the roof! The creature slams into the roof repeatedly, but the corrugated metal is both light and resilient.  It bends, the frustrated monster can't get enough "bite" to tear through it.  Val and Melvin straddle the peak of the roof trying desperately to hang on as it heaves up, buckling l bronco. Earl scrambles into the bulldozer driver's seat and heads after them at full throttle, the big diesel roaring. Melvin and Val prepare to jump onto the bulldozer, but ju before it reaches them the roof suddenly starts to slide some mad flying carpet, carried from beneath by a creatur Val hangs on like a rodeo rider, struggling to keep fear- crazed Melvin from tumbling off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof zigs and zags, spins and twists.  Melvin and Val won't be shaken loose.  Earl does his best to head it off but it's hard to predict which way the roof will scoot ne The rood careens alongside the edge of a dirt-walled drai ditch, then suddenly skitters sideways and plunges over t edge.  Melvin and Val tumble to the bottom.  As they jump their feet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got about three seconds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val sees, almost right above them, an exposed pipe which spans the ditch.  He shoves Melvin toward it.  They leap and grab the pipe, pulling their legs up as high as they An instant later, the creature blasts through one wall of ditch, roars past beneath them and burrows into the oppos wall! Earl brings the bulldozer to a thundering stop next to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Mindy huddle together on their roof.  The uprai scoop blade of the bulldozer comes INTO SHOT with Val rid it.  He helps them step across into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is using a hacksaw to cut lengths from a heavy verti pipe to which his TV antenna was anchored.  Heather works with the sections Burt has already cut off.  She is filli them with gunpowder from reloading cannisters and hammeri the ends shut -- they're making bombs. Then they hear rumbling.  What is it, more creatures?  Th surprised by the odd sight of the strange contraption approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) God damn!  Armored transport!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val climbs up on the bulldozer roll cage so he's about ev with Heather and Burt.  A creature occasionally slams int underside of the bulldozer of the semi trailer, rocking t slightly, throwing up clouds of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go you two.  We're headed for the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a coil of blackpowder cannon fuse.  He cuts off length and stuffs it in the end of one of the pipe bombs during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Burt, we can't hold still long.  They're damn smart and getting smarter by the minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt hefts the finished bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.  We've got some new things to teach them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!  They'll sink this rig just like a boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the bulldozer starts to tilt sideways, creature digging dirt away beneath it.  Earl guns it forward out o the depression they're making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that?  They're doing it now! They try it every time we hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Heather are impressed.  They rush around the rooftop, gathering food, ammo, guns, the finished bombs, handing them to impatient Val who hands them down to peop in the semi trailer during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, we're only going nine miles.  Be there in two hours, tops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well those things are gonna be on our ass every foot of the way, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up to rifles to Heather, the HK91 assault rifle another elephant gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?  Max firepower or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go for penetration.  The 458 shooting solids -- less ammo to carry anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt nods.  Everyone on the bulldozer and semi trailer sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adlib) Come on! Who cares! Forget it! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust flies up.  The bulldozer tilts.  Earl guns it forwar again.  Heather and Burt grab a few more things and leap into the semi trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a gun!  I'll take one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't give you a gun if it was World War Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl pilots the strange looking contraption out into the desert.  Burt and Heather watch their fortress-home reced

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food for five years.  A thousand gallons of gas.  Air filtration. Water filtration.  Geiger counter. Bomb shelter... (looks heavenward) ...underground goddamn monsters?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather puts a consoling arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bulldozer easily lumbers along the really rough road saw Val and Earl's truck struggle over the other morning. As they come closer we see Burt and Heather riding "shotg he sitting out in the bulldozer's scoop, she on the rear the semi trailer, elephant guns at the ready.  Val, Earl Rhonda are in the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late afternoon, sun casting dramatic shadows across beautiful desert.  We are WIDE on the bizarre vehicle, resolutely grinding along not far from the cliffs, nearin the mountains ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they scan the desert, the people are feeling like they get out of this after all.  Earl calls back to the people the semi trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they just gave up, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the bulldozer's too much for them, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they top a gentle rise, Burt excitedly points ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go, solid rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone cheers.  But then Heather points up ahead to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: Perhaps two hundred yards from them, a huge cloud of dust wells up from behind big boulders.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Everyone stares uneasily at the billowing cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else could it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they're taking a dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going over there, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We go straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it.  What the hell are they doing?  They're up to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what they're doing as long as they're doing it way over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl shoves the throttle all the way.  The engine screams

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE IN through the cloud of dust.  Dirt is flying by ton out of en eight foot diameter hole in the ground.  A mound of the tunneled-out dirt is already piled high.  Th creatures are digging a tunnel -- but why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch the bulldozer rumbling along.  It seems unstop- able.  The mountains and safety are barely a mile away -- when the EARTH CAVES IN!!  THE BULLDOZER PLUNGES NOSE FIR

dialogues.speaker: INTO AN UNSEEN PIT DUG JUST BENEATH THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: The machine ends up half-buried at a steep angle.  The se trailer is right on the edge of the pit.  Everyone is sha bruised, bloodied.  Val, Earl and Rhonda look frantically Burt, who was riding out front in the scoop.  They're relieved to see him clawing his way out of pit.  Val haul him up and all four of them now leap into the semi traile As they come to rest, Val slowly realizes what's happened

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They...they dug a trap!  I can't believe this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idling bulldozer engine coughs and dies.  There is a moment's crushing silence. Then the dreaded digging begins.  Dust boils up around th semi trailer -- creatures digging from below!  The semi trailer shakes and shudders, slowly sinking.  The people huddle together in sheer panic.  Val and Earl grab the nearest of Burt and Heather's guns and fire wildly, hope- lessly, down at the dirt.  Ricochets whine into the dista Burt grimly digs an overloaded knapsack for one of his pipe bombs.  He leaps up between Val and Earl and lights fuse, looking for a target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry?!  Eat this!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the bomb at some churning earth and dives back the semi trailer. Keep your heads down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM!  The explosion throws up a big plume of dust and rocks.  We hear a new, very strange sound of pain from th creatures.  The semi trailer instantly stops shaking.  Th creatures have stopped digging.  All is quiet. The people peer up over the edge of the semi trailer, loo all around.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numerous spurts of dust mark their paths as they race mad away, fanning out from the semi trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Burt...did you get one...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there's still four of them. See...there's like four different dust trails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure got their attention, though. Nice going, Burt. (to Earl) Earl, what about the Cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl's already staring down at the bulldozer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  It's down for the count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toward the cliffs he sees a big rock outcrop.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rhonda points in the opposite direction from where Val is looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come!  They're coming back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather unexpectedly fire two deafening blasts from her elephant gun at the approaching creatures, then shakes he head, frustrated.  They're still coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, everybody!  We gotta run for those rocks over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Val, it's pretty far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man!  They'll get us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There sure as hell get us if we stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, listen.  Burt do you have any more of those things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bombs?  Damn right I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what is you throw one that way, the way we want to go... (points toward rocks) Then, when the explosion happens... if it drives them away again...we all run like goddamn bastards! (to Earl) Pardon my French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wham!  With a jolt the semi trailer begins shaking and shuddering again -- sinking, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't scare them? What if they don't run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it does scare them! It hurts them!  They're  so sensitive to sound, they have to run!  It hurts too much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glances all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got my vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  We're gonna run.  Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val squats in front of tear-streaked Mindy. Mindy, you understand what we're going to do? (off her nod) And don't worry, they can't get us once we're on those rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, man.  They're too fast!  You can't outrun them, no way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Burt readies another bomb, he pauses to hand bug-eyed Melvin a huge Ruger Super Redhawk 44 magnum handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, kid.  This'll make'em think twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin's eyes bug out further.  Burt lights his bomb. Heads down!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurls the bomb.  Wait.  Wait.  WHOOOM!  Again we hear creatures' unearthly shriek of pain.  Rhonda's on her fee before the rocks stop falling.  She spots the creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked!  There they go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET'S DO IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl lets out a war wild WHOOP.  It's infectious.  CRANE with them as everyone piles out of the semi trailer like soldiers out of a trench -- they charge across no-man's-l Melvin runs like a demon.  He tries to shoot at the first thing he sees but the gun just clicks over and over -- em

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt, you bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, he doubles his speed, trying to overtake Burt. Mindy can't keep up.  Nancy tries to pull her along.  Val Earl swoop in, grab Mindy under either arm, and carry her between them.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURES
dialogues.text: The ground heaves violently as the retreating monsters angrily wheel about and charge back after the humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big slabs jutting this way and that -- a rock iceberg in sand ocean.  The people scramble onto it amid whoops of j and relief.  Melvin charges up to Burt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole!  There's no bullets in this gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you moving, didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt's line gets a laugh from people, but then tentacles burst up on all sides of the rock, probing, feeling.  The effect is instantly sobering.  Burt swiftly grabs out his remaining bombs -- six of them -- and holds one ready.  B they're in no immediate danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we make it to the mountains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures to Burt's bombs) No way.  We'd need fifty of those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hopelessness of the situation suddenly hits Val, Earl and Rhonda.  After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...that's it.  We're not getting off this rock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not going to pole vault anywhere. That's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?  What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll just wait out there till we're dead.  That's what they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As this sinks in, Burt loses his cool, igniting an argume

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Well, for chrissake, we could have made a stand at our place!  We had food, water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't fight'em that way...
