dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two jackasses hauled us way the hell out here...!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK OFF, BURT...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who put you two in charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Burt!  Those animals would have killed you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares in surprise at normally quiet Nancy. (softly) You haven't seen what they can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmer) They'd have dug your place out from under you in half an hour!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long, grim silence.  Everyone sits glumly. Finally, Burt picks up a bomb and contemplates it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) If it comes to starvation, I know what I'm doing.  Take one of these. Walk right out there with the fuse lit.  Stuff it down my pants and let 'em take me down.  BOOOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather puts a soothing hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now Earl brightens a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that's not a bad idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others react.  Is Earl nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, it gives me an idea... going fishing like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the open desert, a rock lands.  Then another.  Val and Rhonda are throwing them from the rock outcrop. Val, Earl, Rhonda, and Burt have moved away from the main group to another section of the rock outcrop where intervening boulders will protect everyone from an explos Earl has tied a bomb to some nylon rope form one of Burt' knapsacks.  Burt places the other bombs safely out of the behind a ledge.  Meanwhile, Val and Rhonda keep throwing rocks.  Soon, the ground shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  Right straight out in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt has his coil of fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...  They're pretty quick...fifteen seconds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt nods, expertly eyeballing a fifteen second length an snipping it off.  As he stuffs it into the bomb:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cannon fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you use it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) My cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bomb is ready -- it's moment of truth.  Earl digs in pocket for the lighter -- but Val has it.  Val nervously leans over to light the fuse, but then frowns as he sees Earl is holding the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you're not going to do your lasso thing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, just 'cause you're no good with a rope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val shakes his head and lights the fuse.  Earl whirls the bomb on the end of its rope like a lasso, and lets it fly as far as he can.  Then he starts pulling it back in alon the ground like a fishing lure.  Rhonda stares at her wat as they all sink down behind the protective boulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it...take the bait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a snout subtly surfaces and gulps down the bomb. tense two seconds later -- KABOOOM!  Bullseye!  It's a volcano of gory creature parts.  They splatter all over! remaining creatures shriek and race away again.  The peop cheer wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Earl, Rhonda, and Burt prepare to try again.  This t Val has the rope and a new bomb.  Rhonda stands by him, r with the lighter.  Earl lobs rocks out into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are they?  Hope they didn't wise up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Nope, there!  That's one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda shakily lights the fuse.  Val heaves the bomb out starts trolling.  The creature swallows it.  Everyone dro down behind the boulder, Val impulsively grabbing a secon bomb. They tense with anticipatory glee -- but the creatu suddenly spits its bomb back out!  It sails back right ov their heads.  It strikes the rocks above them, skittering down a crevice and landing in -- BURT'S PILE OF BOMBS! Val, Earl, and Rhonda scatter.  Burt dives backward over rock ledge. BABABAMMM!!  All the bombs explode, throwing rocks every- where.  The creatures streak away.  Val, Earl and Rhonda sprawl into the dirt, half stunned. When the panic is over, Val and Earl realize where they a fifty yards out in open desert!  So is Rhonda, off at an angle from them!  Only Burt is safe on the rock outcrop. And the creatures are coming back fast! The stranded trio starts back for the outcrop, but the creatures burst up ahead of them -- one blocking Rhonda's path, the other two cutting Val and Earl off!  The creatu roar toward their easy prey! Val and Earl freeze.  The ground bulges as the creatures "skid" to a halt not ten feet from them.  Rhonda stands s still some fifty feet away, eyeing her own creature. Over on the outcrop with the main group of people Heather sizes up the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make noise.  Everybody!  COME ON!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone starts hopping up and down, yelling, screaming, clapping.  Burt even runs a few feet out from the rocks, firing a pistol into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COME ON, YOU SLIMEBAGS!  OVER HERE! FRESH MEAT...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd keeps up the ruckus.  The creatures are distrac by the noise, but this time they don't automatically go a it.  Their big snouts turn uncertainly this way and that. But they just stay where they are.  Their hook-tentacles slide out, feeling all around.  Earl whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not falling for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather takes careful aim with her elephant gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make'em pay attention goddamnit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before she can fire, the creatures mysteriously sink view.  Val, Rhonda, and Earl remain frozen.  What the hel going on?  Nothing happens -- then -- A HUGE HUMP OF EARTH suddenly wells up near Rhonda.  It s back down as fast as it appeared.  It's like the creature suddenly lifted its whole body almost to the surface then submerged again.  Another hump rises and falls right near and Earl.  There's a pause as the men whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're...they're trying to make us move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or just knock us over.  Look, use the bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's out last one.  We can't kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures try another random "barrage" of humps, some coming perilously close.  They know they'll eventually to their prey.  One comes so close to Val and Earl that pebb roll down its sides into their boots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the fucking bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we get back on that rock and in three days we're dead anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly; terrified) I want to live for the three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More humps rise and fall.  Val gives in.  He signals Rhon gesturing with the bomb.  She understands.  He'll set it driving away the creatures, and they'll all run back to t outcrop. Val digs for the lighter.  Doesn't have it.  Earl digs fo it, too.  But he doesn't have it either!  They go dead pa How can that be?  They look across fifty feet of deadly o ground -- trembling Rhonda holds up the lighter! Over on the outcrop, Burt shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?  Use the bomb, for Godsake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val signals to Rhonda to throw the lighter.  She nods.  B just before she does, A HUMP STARTS RISING DIRECTLY UNDER HER!  She fights to keep her balance -- struggling to kee from taking that single step which will instantly tell th creatures where she is. But there's no hope.  The hump jerks higher.  Her boots s down the gravelly side!  Instantly the creature twists to her, its hungry mouth erupting out of the dirt.  She scre and dashes for Val and Earl.  They run to meet her.  The other creatures surface.  The trio is cut off from the ro outcrop! Val and Earl link up with Rhonda and they all run madly w Rhonda tries to light Val's bomb fuse.  But suddenly Val yanks the bomb away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wait!  This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He veers off in a new direction.  Startled Earl and Rhond have no choice but to follow.  As they desperately try to catch up to Val:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) What the hell are you doing?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I GOT A GODDAMN PLAN!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl looks up ahead.  They're headed right for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive cliffs.  Earl's eyes bug out.  In seconds the be right at the brink with nowhere to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be one great plan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they skid to a stop at the very brink, Val breaks off bomb fuse, leaving only one inch of it.  He whirls to che the progress of the advancing creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the bomb out to Rhonda.  She instantly tries to light it.  He grabs her wrist so hard it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light it, man!  LIGHT IT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, not yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charging creatures are almost underfoot.  Finally Val pulls Rhonda's hand over to light the fuse.  Instantly he hurls the bomb as far as he can, behind the creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too far!  You threw it behind them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground opens under their feet!  Tentacles snake towar Val and Earl.  A horrid mouth clamps onto Rhonda's boot. screams as it starts to pull her down. WHOOOM!!  The bomb explodes!  The creatures shriek in pai instantly releasing their prey and racing away from the painful shock wave in the only direction they can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right out through the face of the cliffs!!  The huge, shrieking creatures seem to hang in mid-air for a moment, their grotesque bodies undulating in pain.  And then they fall!  And fall and fall -- a thousand feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures land on massive jagged rocks, exploding lik immense, horrid watermelons.  Multi-colored gore festoons whole cliff face. TILT UP to see three tiny figures standing at the top of cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val peers down at the distant creatures for a long time. he notices Earl and Rhonda are staring at him.  Where the did he get an idea like that?  After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it just suddenly hit me, you know?  Stampede?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and head back toward the others.  They laugh as they realize how stealthily they are walking.  Val starts taking big, exaggerated stomping steps.  Rhonda and Earl follow suit.  The trio goes off arm in arm, stomping merr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Earl roll two scavenged truck wheels down the str toward their own truck; which is up on jacks, two wheels missing. Mindy races past excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A highway maintenance truck is rolling into town followed a police car.  The townsfolk happily swarm around the MAINTENANCE MEN and POLICE OFFICER who gape at the destro town. Val and Earl eagerly start bolting on one of their new wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Road's in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Road's in!  Now, soon as we hit Bixby we start making phone calls. We could make some real money off this whole thing, get in People magazine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People?  Hell, National Geographic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell the movie rights.  We're going straight from blue-collar to white -collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...but no ties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda pulls up in her truck, leans out and snaps their picture with a top-of-the-line Nikon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys.  Burt loaned me his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really leaving, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.  You gonna be staying up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah!  There's going to be major research up here.  First thing is to get some pictures of that one we dug up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward pause.  Finally she extends her hand to them. just gives it a quick shake. Uh...well, maybe I'll see you two sometime... (to Val) And thanks for everything, you know, saving my life and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) Well...you're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes at him, just a hint of something in her eyes. springs to attention.  Is the boy blind?  Then Rhonda sna out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod.  She drives off.  Earl stares at Val who starts putting the second wheel on the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Val, maybe she's not your type, but you could, at least, be civil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civil?  I'm civil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not civil, you're glum.  We got the world by the tail with a downhill pull and all of a sudden you go glum on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl freezes as a bell goes off in his head. Oh my God.  She got to you.  You do like her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody paying you to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just practically asked you for a date.  What the hell is wrong?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val glares at Earl for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl, get real.  What does she need with a guy like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?  All this time she's not good enough for you.  Now, suddenly, you're not good enough for her?  God, my work is never done. You don't decide is you're worthless, she does.  But you gotta give her a chance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val lowers the jack letting the truck down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl, I'm not gonna make a fool of myself!  You got that covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl stands there fuming, mind racing.  A last ditch idea hits home -- we see a devilish glint in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, make the mistakes I did. I think I'll just be playing this hand myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes both of us.  We both helped her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so full of shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  Think about this:  She ain't as narrow-minded as you. I'll lay odds she's looking for character in a man.  For my part, I'd be proud to have her.  I'd goddamn worship her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl hops into the truck. I'm going out there right now, help her take those pictures...set up her seismo-jiggers.  Whatever she wants.  Who the hell knows what'll happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl starts to drive off.  Val springs into the passenger seat.  Through the truck's rear window we see Val raise h hand in The Challenge.  They do a round of scissors-rock- paper -- but it's a tie.  They go again.  Another tie.  T keep playing and tying as they drive off into the distanc and we --
